description:
Been here a few times and I've always liked their food. It fires on all cylinders - quality, quantity, price, cleanliness, service, and the list goes on. I've never tried but have heard a lot about their lunch special which has a soup and a main dish. Of the 2 times I've been here, I tried their Mongolian chicken and the house spicy fried rice chicken. I liked the fried rice but I would go for the Mongolian chicken the next time I'm here. 

Have also been here with vegetarians and they seemed to love the food as each dish had a vegetarian option with a pretty diverse selection of vegetables. Would highly recommended this place!
author: Akshat G.

description:
UPDATE: my partner and I got upset stomachs after ordering dinner for delivery tonight. Too bad because I wanted to love this place.

My go to Chinese restaurant in the Hayes Valley/Lower Height area. I usually order the string bean chicken and moo shu veggie (burrito like wrap). Each dish runs $11-$13, which is reasonable and there's enough food for 2 people. I've done both sit down and takeout, and found both experiences to be pleasant. Service is great. Food can be on the salty side, but they always refill water.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Don't ask for tea at lunch- it's another $3 bucks and they won't mention that. 

Ordered General Tsao Chicken, allegedly $8.75 for lunch. Service prompt, portions good, soup great, but fairly horrible main dish. Oilier than Rockefeller, bland and very tough over cooked meat. On the plus side, 3 big steamed broccoli stalks to help clear it through the colon. 

Pleasant decoration behind the bar, looks like several beers on tap. Plenty of seating- and with the quality of this food I'm not surprised much of it was empty. 

The Thai place across Fillmore is pretty good, next time I'll not be sidetracked trying to find another winner. This place looked promising, but just dumped $15 on food tasting worse than a $9 meal at Panda Express.
author: T J.

description:
This is my go to restaurant when I work near Haight st. I've only had their lunch specials which are priced reasonably and I would always get egg plant basil with fried tofu and brown/white rice. 

They give you complimentary corn soup that's always great and consistent. 

My coworker would always love their fried rice and he said it's his favorite. 

Overall good service and easy to understand menu.
author: Brian L.

description: Big shrimp. Excellent house fried rice & house chowmein. Bathroom was cleaned well and fresh. Priced well for median dinner. A definite place to return to eat in the near future!!!
author: Keegan B.

description: I didn't dine in I ordered take out, waited about 45 mins as they stated so it was on time. I ordered a vegetable fried rice and an orange chicken (I think) it was delicious! Definitely worth the money
author: Yannick R.

description: This is really a hit or miss place. Sometimes it's great, sometimes it's not great. I got their cumin lamb and it was tooo oily. Recently my roommate and I ordered their fish dish and we were perplexed at how the bill came out to be 38 bucks. When previously it was only around 30. So always ask what the total is before you place your order. Also they don't serve rice with their dishes so that's an extra thing. Once we ordered and were surprised rice didn't come along with it
author: Dhruv M.

description: I absolutely love this place! Best Chinese food I ever had! All the food was freshly made. The staff are really friendly. The ace is clean and they and good music. I would suggest this restaurant to anyone looking for good Chinese food. Yummy!!!
author: Brandy W.

description: I love their lunch specials and beef chow fun, very reasonably priced and portion is great!!
author: Fawn Q.

description:
This spot has consistently had good service and good food. I haven't been in a while and stopped to pick up a phone order. 

I was disappointed in the food, it was more flavorful than some places but the beef broccoli I got for the kids tasted like Corn starch, the egg rolls were extra greasy and unfortunately the hot and Sour Soup I ordered was won ton. That was enough to make me think twice about going back for take out.
author: Ben M.

description: The person in charge on 7/21/18 right before closing was extremely rude and slapped my hand as he was trying to grab my phone. I will call the owner tomorrow. They shouldn't have an employee who's rude and almost assaults a customer. I was recording him and will be pressing charges.
author: Laura C.

description:
In all honesty, my Spirit Airline miles are about to expire, so I needed some activity and I saw that Wonderland is on the list of Spirit's RewardNetwork for Dining which gives miles for purchases at select restaurants, Wonderland is participating.  I ordered chicken chow mein to go, $10.44 including tax, and it was good.

As I look at their menu, I notice they serve meatless chicken (see the attached pik from their menu).  This world use to be so simple.  And what's next, fortuneless fortune cookies?

Honestly, now that I know (after the fact) that I'm eating "meatless chicken", I rather doubt I'll return.
author: Steve M.

description:
I won't say much but I used to be a fan of Wonderland until I found a but in my wonton soup yesterday and was very disgusted by it.
I will not frequent this restaurant any longer, because I'm concerned about the cleanliness of the place.
I called and asked for my money back, but I was upset at the fact that they thought I was lying.
I asked him to come in and see, but he refused.
I work in a hospital, there are no bugs flying around here.
author: Tiffany F.

description:
The food at Wonderland is better than the average Chinese-American takeout, but the service is horrible, even when you get delivery. We ordered egg-fried rice -- it's not on the menu but is a staple of Chinese menus. To be sure we got it the way we wanted it I specified in the notes ("Egg, peas, carrots, green onions only"). They obviously didn't read the notes and simply sent the standard vegetable-fried rice from the menu. 

It's also really expensive -- charge $9:50 for fried rice and I expect white truffles shaved on top (well, maybe one slice).

The delivery guy is another lowlight. We let him know that we will buzz him in and he can come on up but he doesn't want to climb the stairs so he just stands there at the gate and waits for us to come down.
author: Skylar R.

description:
Man, these 1 star ratings really bring this place down. I have not found a better Chinese place in the city. Seriously. Okay maybe I'll have a closer look at my food before eating it from now on, but the General Tso's Chicken is insanely good. It's gotta be that sauce. (Add pineapple for a sweet kick.) The pepper steak is literally sizzling, so seriously keep it covered until they say. Maybe even longer. That ish splatters, but it's amazing and worth a little arm burn.
Also, I don't know about the ladies room, but the men's bathroom sink hot water comes out.. whatever hotter than scorching is. It. will. burn. you. But again.. worth it.
Enjoy!
author: Bryan P.

description: While the food was rather decent, especially when in SF you compare any Chinese food with that found in China town. The service is where they lose their stars. After we got our food we asked for some water and never got it even after asking again about 5 times. The bill took forever to get. While our table was in the corner, we were not invisible.
author: Andrew V.

description: I just ordered today 06/22/2018 At 11:30 am one General tso chicken and sesame chicken lunch special. While I was eating the General tso chicken I noticed something black and looks like insect on my chicken so I peeled the coat of the chicken away and look inside and extracted it to find a black ant! There was a black ant on my chicken that was fried with my food!! I can't believe I paid for this. This place is not clean and allowing ants and other insects to be infiltrate their food. I will never order from here again! They are so unfortunate the they lost a customer!
author: Jennifer N.

description: I Haight this place. I take my date to eat there and the server was meh. But the thing that got us was the server brought us dirty water. ONE OF THE GLASSES HAD LIPSTICK ALL OVER IT. AND SHE STILL SERVED IT TO US. We walked out the minute we saw this and were very disappointed. I rarely give one star reviews, but if I had to walk out of a restaurant because of dirty, not well-kept dishes or glasses, this place deserves less than one star. I would never go back there.
author: Tony T.

description: Came across this place simply because I was craving Chinese food one day on the way home from work. Glad I did because I found great food and friendly service and a great price. The red oil wantons here are awesome and you can never go wrong with the classic orange chicken, beef chow mein and Mongolian beef. I've been to this place at least a dozen times in the last year and every friend and family member I've introduced Wonderland to has always thoroughly enjoyed their meal here. I'm also writing this review as I wait for a free delivery which is another perk of wonderland. Can't go wrong with this place!
author: Karim L.

description:
I was really disappointed with my meal. I got my order to go- I wasn't expecting much, but I wasn't expecting it to be as bad as it was. I ordered the sesame chicken off of the lunch menu, which comes with steamed rice and soup. I started with the soup- I could tell by the smell that it was over spiced w/black pepper, and boy was I right. The taste of the black pepper over powered the soup. I couldn't enjoy it at all.
The sesame chicken was just as disappointing, if not moreso. The chicken was incredibly dry/tough, and the sauce tasted pretty off. The bed of greens the chicken was placed on seemed insanely wilted/old. This was not a result of being exposed to the heat. Even if it was, the greens shouldn't have seemed as wilted as they were. I went there shortly after they opened for lunch, and the food did not seem fresh *at all*. The only decent thing about the meal was the steamed rice and the fortune cookie (which isn't saying much). :|
I typically will give places a second try if it doesn't move me the first time around but I don't see that happening here.  That was a sad waste of $12. Go at your own risk.
author: Frances A.

description: Been here about 50 times. Amazing food, best deal for lunch in the area. If you're looking for good Chinese food, big portions, great crab Rangoon - look no further.
author: Martin W.

description: This place is amazing!!! Best food anywhere! Seriously the orange chicken is to die for! Please go with a large group and you will not be disappointed.
author: Raelen L.

description: I love their shrimp fried rice. Only thing I've ever had from their, but it's pretty top tier.
author: Chelsea R.

description:
So, Ningzhe W. the Owner, has reached out to me with an apology.  He has ask me to reply with date and time of my appalling experience of eating Wonderland food~

"It would be very helpful if you could reply to this message with the date & time of your visit."  

Sunday, April 23, at approximately 4:30 to 5:30 p.m. our food totaled to $106 & some change.

" I sincerely hope we can have the opportunity to provide you with a much-improved experience in the future."

Fortunately, I didn't get physically ill, but mentally, I lost my appetite and my love for Chinese food!  



Ningzhe W. 
Owner 

Hello Christena, I wanted to personally reach out and sincerely apologize to you for your recent dining experience. We always strive to provide delicious and quality cuisine, and it looks like we sorely missed the mark with your meal. We don't often hear of complaints of this nature, and I have stressed the importance of being more vigilant in cleaning all produce and preparing all food. We take these kinds of issues seriously and will be doing everything we can to make sure that this doesn't happen again. Please know we take all Yelp reviews and customer feedback seriously, so I would like to further investigate. It would be very helpful if you could reply to this message with the date & time of your visit. I sincerely hope we can have the opportunity to provide you with a much-improved experience in the future. Thank you for bringing this to my attention.

Fortunately, I didn't get physically ill, but mentally, I lost my appetite and my love for Chinese food!
author: Christena J.

description:
This is authentic Chinese-American food. Looked all over the city for a proper one that compares to New York (like the ones you see detectives eating in their cars during a stakeout). This. is. it.

Chow mein/chow fun? Delicious. Walnut prawns? awesome portions. Orange chicken? You're all set.
author: L.A. C.

description:
This place is really great-quality, clean "American" Chinese food. Great service, and nice decor (not your lil hole-in-the-wall Chinese takeout joint). Would definitely come back to try some of the other dishes! 

We also saw a bunch of other tables with pitchers of beer - which is awesome - gotta come back for that too! 

** The wonton soup is very unconventional. Very unauthentic, but really tasty! It comes with some saucy sautéed pieces of meat (I think both chicken and beef) on top of the soup and wontons. Really satisfying on a cold, gloomy day in SF.

** Dry-braised chicken wings... YUM!! The wings are perfectly fried, with a spicy chili garlicky soy sauce glaze that is so finger-lickin' good! Kind of reminds me of the wings at So in SoMa, and just as good!

** Spicy Fried Rice - We had it with beef, and it was DEVOURED.

** Double Mushroom with Triple Delight... That's scallop, shrimp, and squid. Seafood was pretty fresh, and the mushrooms were good, but all-in-all the dish was a little bland. Not as good as everything else.

Definitely will be back!
author: Ashley S.

description:
If you want meatless chicken, they will give real chicken. If you want raw fried chicken, if you want the delivery kid tell you his tip wasn't enough, this is the place for you! 

First of all..... my coworkers and I USED (NOT NO 'MO) to order from Wonderland 2-3 times a week...estimating around $65 each order ($195/week) 1 out of 3 times the order was wrong. We ordered fried wings, they were PINK and cold inside. (No refund given) Another time we ordered Sesame meatless chicken, they gave our vegan friend REAL CHICKEN. (No refund given) Unacceptable.

The last straw was when we ordered $63 worth of food, the delivery kid walked away and then came back and asked for his tip. We gave him one, but it wasn't enough. He then proceeded to ask WHO ordered food and how many people ordered food. He saw a name on the receipt and asked for the person. The person on the receipt didn't even order food that day. 

Look, giving someone a tip is a LUXURY. He was so ungrateful. For my coworkers and I to order roughly $500/mo worth of food (excl. tip) and he has the AUDACITY to ask us for MORE money???? BYE WONDERLAND. YOU LOST SOME LOYAL A$$ CUSTOMERS BECAUSE YOUR DELIVERY BOY DEMANDED US TO GIVE HIM MORE THAN $15 tip. 

We only had a few wrong orders, but this tip issue....was the end for us.  BYE
author: Heather Y.

description:
I feel like in an ocean full of Chinese food restaurants in the City, it's hard to find one that delivers consistent and tasty food.  Wonderland is on the corner of Haight and Fillmore st.  It's closer to the east end of Haight that doesn't have as many cool things to see, but there are some nice dive bars in the area.  Their pork dumplings are probably my favorite thing to order from there, as they are massive in size and hella juicy!  My mouth is literally watering just by thinking of them. 

Side note - if you don't like a thicker skin on your dumplings, then I would forgo them.

If you're a vegan, they have a bunch of vegan options that I was impressed with as well.  Wonderland is a well rounded restaurant that has a good sized menu with a ton of options.  It's definitely worth checking out the next time you want some good Chinese food in the Haight.
author: Josh S.

description:
By far one of the better restaurants in the lower Haight.  This neighborhood has needed good Chinese and more good places to eat for some time now.

Firstly , I got the lunch special of the Cumin lamb.  I ate my soup so fast that the waiter offered me a refill at no extra charge.  The salad was composed of quality mixed greens with a tasty miso dressing.  The lamb was thin sliced and tender with a very nice flavor.

Especially for 6.95 this was an amazing meal.  Also looks like a great vegi selection.
author: David J.

description: Pretty good. I got the duck lunch special + tomato egg flower soup. The duck could have used more meat in my opinion, but it comes with a side of soup (egg flower this time) which is cool.
author: Ariella V.

description: VEGETARIANS/VEGANS BEWARE - every chance I give to this place to provide me a meat free meal has ended in me consuming some meat product. I understand that special orders are sometimes lost, but you can only give a place so many chances.
author: Mikey C.

description:
Ordered online after reading reviews
Wasn't too impressed with their food
Delivery was on time, ordered via online so review solely on food only.  I ordered hot and sour soup and orange chicken, it was ok but prob will try other places.
author: Clara K.

description: This is my go to spot, I can't tell you how many times I've been here and the food has always been excellent. Love this place, and their takeout comes quickly.
author: Ismar M.

description:
Wonderland is a great restaurant when you're craving American style Chinese food with a nice, relaxing dinner vibe. They feature "Chinese" food like Crab Rangoon, Mango Chicken, and different stir fry noodle dishes. Don't come here for authentic home cooking or a cultural experience (every customer in the restaurant was white), but it's good in its own right. Start with the scallion pancakes- they're delicious!

The ambiance is casual enough for a group but also intimate enough for a date. The dim lighting is nice to unwind with. Would be a nice touch if they offered a pot of tea like many other Chinese restaurants. Since I live in the area, and the food is good and will leave you satisfied, I would definitely go again.
author: Leeyen R.

description: great vegetarian chinese -- the greasy, salty, wonderful kind! highly recommend.
author: Bryce G.

description: This is a great Chinese restaurant I've dined in and ordered delivery. I prefer dine in because they give you a side salad with their lunch special. They have great prices and food! I had the sesame chicken, chicken and veggies, egg flower soup & OMG in love with the brown rice!!!
author: Brenda M.

description:
Vegetarian and carnivore heaven. These words don't often go together.

A large menu offered modern Chinese food, with good sized portions and crazy low prices. For less than a takeaway you get polite service and a chilled atmosphere.

The restaurant is light's and airy, with high ceilings and slightly faded decor.

My enthusiasm is solid on their "meatless chicken" menu, with options including General Tsao, orange and sweet n sour. My meat eating friend had the same: hers with real chicken. The sauce was flavorful, and the lunch menu included free soup and salad.

If I lived closer, this would be my go to Chinese.
author: Zara S.

description: Great spot! Perfect service and great food for a quick bite - super speedy and delicious! Will be back! Get the beef and broccoli and hot and sour soup!
author: Andee G.

description: Was so delighted to find out that Wonderland was open for Christmas dinner! Went with a friend and brightened up what was (until that point) a very forgettable day. The portions here are very generous and two dishes (with rice side dishes) was more than enough for two hungry men in their 20s! The service was a bit slow but very friendly and professional, and overall it was a great dining experience. The food speaks for itself, and it's a great value. Can't wait to go back soon!
author: Andy L.

description: It was too bad that this place got a poor health department rating, but it looks like they've really cleaned up their act, no pun intended.    I decided to risk it and I was just delighted with their food.  I got kung pow chicken, smoked pork with garlic sauce, and chicken in black bean sauce.  Everything was piping hot and freshly prepared, the ingredients were very fresh, just enough sauce, and they had it ready for me in 15 minutes.  The kung pow might have been a little spicier, and the smoked pork could go for being a lot smokier, but everything was absolutely delicious.
author: John G.

description: I thought I would give this restaurant to drive since I haven't ordered from here before and I have been getting some cash back rewards from here but, I wasn't happy with the crab Rangoon I ordered  because I couldn't taste any crab or see any when I pulled the pieces apart. I also ordered two main dishes that were fine but were oily.
author: Nicole G.

description: So far I have nothing but good things to say about this restaurant. I work nearby and plan on trying out all the lunch menu, lol. So far I've tried three things and all were great. I love their fried rice. Great portions for a great price. They are really fast for lunch too, which is a plus, enough time to eat and get back to work.
author: Janet R.

description: Consistent. Good.  Great for lunch.  Nice chilled glasses for sierra on tap. Fair prices.
author: R G.

description: We are regulars at Wonderland. If you are looking for Americanized Chinese food, this is your place. My litmus tests for Chinese restaurants are: General Gau's Chicken (one of the best if slightly too much breading) and Potstickers (okay). The hot and sour soup is very good as is the Chicken in Black Bean Sauce. Wine is ridiculously cheap ($6). The environment is not great (why don't Chinese restaurants work on their dining experience??) with an  overlit, usually cold, space. The staff is very nice, yet mostly absent once you get your food, off and prepping veggies at a table nearby, heads down, not super aware if you need something. Like another $6 glass of wine! So, I am a fan and think the food is good.
author: Michael C.

description: This used to be our go-to Chinese delivery place.  Until they raised the minimum of delivery from $25 to $35.  And then swapped their meatless chicken with other kind that allegedly has inferior texture and taste (I live with a vegetarian).  Compared to the competitors (Big Lantern in Mission & Kung Food in NoPa), their food is less greasy and seasoned better.
author: Ryoko M.

description: Great food (4 stars for that) but holy crap your delivery service (-3 stars for that) is the WORST. Seriously it's the WORST. 3.5 hours for a delivery on a Sunday really isn't cool. Thanks for the "it's on it's way BS". No apology, no sorry, it won't happen again. Urg. Drive me crazy! You could be so much better.
author: Paul W.

description: Food is very good here and reasonably priced, but the service is very slow and inattentive so -1 star.
author: Narek A.

description:
We bring everyone that comes to visit us in SF from here for multiple reasons...

1) Food is always delicious
2) Food is always brought out fast
3) last but not least service is Awesome!

Ok fine the real reason we always come here is because of his Ray Lei! Always makes us feel like he's serving his own family! He goes above and beyond to provide awesome service and great service goes a long way these days....  

We will be back again and again and again!
author: Angy G.

description:
I ordered delivery recently and after waiting an hour and a half, I called to check on the progress. The order was lost. The person on the phone didn't speak English very well and he seemed incompetent as to what to do. He asked if I still wanted the food and I said yes, since I was starving at this point. I also asked for a full refund and he said ok. 

A few days later I get a refund of half the amount. 

Terrible business management.
author: Foodie F.

description:
Five stars is a rarity for me but this is by far the best damn Chinese food I have ever had.

Friday night, not crowded. Pitchers of beer for $10. (wow!)

Start with the steamed dumplings. They aren't frozen, they're more like dimsum that potstickers. Really doughy and delicious. 

Onion pancake was also delish.

For meals, chicken with mixed vegetables was my favorite: fresh bokchoy, asparagus, broccoli, carrots. Also the moo shu pork was excellent. Massive portions, while we ate it all, one meal is enough for two the split.

Service was good. The place is also reasonably priced. I might move to the lower haight just to have this place on my delivery radar.
author: Sarah S.

description: Best Chinese food ever, cooked to perfection and delivered fast. The rangoons and general tsoa are our favorite. Love this place.
author: Brenna E.

description: Came in here with a friend while looking for place to eat before a night out. Pleasantly surprised by the friendly service (the server smiled for us and other tables she was serving! This can be rare in a Chinese restaurant), clean atmosphere, and food arrive extremely quickly! The food was pretty good as well and came in huge servings. We over-ordered because we thought they were individual entrees with rice, but imagine 10-inch plates with General's Chicken and Ma-Po Tofu. Would definitely come here again for the food and the service!
author: Jon P.

description: Yum! I used to just be complacent about this place but they changed up their menu and the food magically got really, really good. I kinda love it now. That's saying a lot for Chinese food in San Francisco.
author: Russ S.

description:
Looking for a quick lunch in this Lower Haight hood, Wonderland by its name and prominence on the corner of Haight & Fillmore. The lower the Haight, the betta. Wonderment Wonderful Wonderland. Itsa fine place to have lunch,w/ a kinda name for a joint that is not apologetic, good for them. 

Kinda loved the interpretation of a Chinese lunch special that included a mixed lettuce salad. Service was terrific. Kinda wished I had a friend named Alice... to dine w/ me and my spouse.
author: Matsuo U.

description: Just 2 stars. Not really sure what to say about the food. The sweet & sour chicken didn't look like chicken. The shrimp fried rice looked & tasted like something I could make at home. Poor presentation, bad quality, & overpriced.
author: Richard J.

description:
This is my go to Chinese restaurant in the area. The service is pleasant and quick, but most importantly the food is very very tasty. My standard order (which I get to-go more often than I care to admit) includes the onion pancakes and the egg plant basil with fried tofu, but I've had the orange and sesame chicken and enjoy those too. Everything comes out hot, freshly prepared, and well seasoned. 
 I've never been able to finish the portions, and, while I'm not always a big leftover-eater, I always look forward to having Wonderland the next day. I also think it's good value. The other day I went with three other people and we got a loooot of food. When we split the check amongst us all, we each only owed $15 before tip. Not bad. Not bad.
author: Anna D.

description: I eat lunch here all the time. Great,fresh food. Serious lunch special with tons of choices on a nice sunny corner. Everything is good. I prefer the hot and sour soup to the egg flower corn soup.mongoluan beef , curry chicken, and bbq with veggies as well as map of tofu pork are some of my favorites.i love the staff.
author: Christina M.

description:
I'm really disappointed in Wonderland Restaurant. I live in the neighborhood and have eaten here for years. They recently got a 70 Health Score, (which is atrocious), which caused me to look into it. Looks like they had a 70 score back in 2014 as well... so they've had a chance to clean up their act and have not done so.

A few of the choice violations: 
Inadequate food safety knowledge
Improper food storage
Improper storage use or identification of toxic substances
Moderate risk vermin infestation
Inadequate warewashing facilities or equipment
Improper thawing methods
Moderate risk vermin infestation

A few of these were the same as back in 2014, which means management at Wonderland just doesn't care. Food safety isn't something to take lightly. 

I used to like this place but now need to find another go-to Chinese food place.

Message to Wonderland's management - get your act together, clean up your kitchen, and keep it that way, or people will stop coming to your restaurant.
author: Jake L.

description:
I have had Wonderland twice now which seems to be typical of other Yelpers reviewing this restaurant. I'd give it 2.5 stars overall-3 for when I ordered delivery and 2 for when I ate at the restaurant (average of 2.5).

Delivery Experience: 3 stars
-I ordered a meatless dish but can't remember what it is. I'm not able to view their menu online without starting the ordering process which is a bummer.
-I do remember the dish was decent and I was pleasantly surprised at how well it was made to be imitation meat. It wasn't the best Chinese food I've had but it was fine.
-Delivery was quick and ordering online was easy.

Restaurant Experience: 2 stars
-My boyfriend and I were seated immediately as there was only one other person eating in the restaurant.
-We ordered the Crab Rangoons, Chow Fun with Chicken, and the Kung Pao Chicken. The Crab Rangoons were 90% cream cheese and 10% crab-still good but better described as "cream cheese rangoons." My boyfriend said the Kung Pao was really good and tasted fresh but I was very disappointed in the Chow Fun. There was a sparse sprinkling of bean sprouts and green onions and it was pretty bland. Not terrible but not memorable.
-Service was really odd. Our waitress didn't seem to understand what we were saying and when trying to order. When we were signing the check she came over, realized we weren't done, and then speed-walked away super fast. It was a bit bizarre.

I'd say Wonderland is about average when I think of Chinese food places. If you're craving Chinese, this will hit the spot but I'm hesitant to say it will leave a lasting impression.
author: Salma R.

description:
It is a sad situation when you have to give a 1-star rating to a local business.  Unfortunately, my experience with Wonderland Restaurant was a bad experience.  The delivery from the restaurant was 40 minutes late.  When I called asking where my food was the manager on hand said he was sorry but they were so busy.  He offered me a discount, but I informed him I had already paid ahead of time so he told me he would put the food on the house.  The food was delivered and was cold.

When I called back to confirm the refund with GrubHub, as I was advised by the manager, Wonderland then said they would offer me a discount on a future purchase.  The fact of the matter is, I have no intention of ordering from Wonderland again and I am pretty disappointed that they are going back on what they told me over the phone.  At the end of the day, I am sure the food is decent, but when you lie to your customers and deliver food 40 minutes late it leaves a bad taste in their mouth (pun intended).
author: Michael F.

description: Bad service. I came to pick up my food, it was already paid for. The man insisted on seeing the ID and card from the purchase,  before giving me the order. I didn't have them on me, so I went back to my car to get the credentials and showed them to him anyway. Despite how strange I thought the whole thing was considering the food was already paid for. I figured I'd simply pick up the food order and leave. He then proceeds to say "The next time you come here you need to...", as I politely walked away because there will not be a next time. I do not take kindly to strangers, telling me what I need to do.
author: Fatima K.

description:
Ok , so now I'm sick at work on a cold day , I'll order from wonderland since they aren't that bad but I hate their delivery driver (Jimmy) , and just to prove a point I pulled out the exact change only for him to complain no tip with his hand out staring at me like he had a problem. 

Now for the one star , I usually don't have a problem with them but today there was hella hair in my chicken and corn soup ... I basically lost my appetite and threw my untouched spicy fried rice away ... Please make ur staff wear hair nets which is the standard
author: Noel M.

description: This place has gone downhill. We've found hair in our to go orders on more than 1 occasion which is 1 too many for me. Their health standards are terrible for this to continue to happen.
author: Chris A.

description:
Now hold on, I thought my body was a wonderland. That's what John Mayer told me, but then he dumped me for Jennifer Aniston and it got ugly... wait a sec, am I mistaking my life story for a National Enquirer story I read once? It wouldn't be the first time. Anyway, this wonderland is more of a culinary adventure, the kind where Alice falls though the rabbit hole and turns into a vegetarian much to the contemptuous disdain of the Red Queen. This spacious place is pretty new with a prime location right at the corner of Fillmore and Haight, and like Eric's in Noe Valley, Wonderland reminds me of Eliza's when it was a good, fresh alternative to all those other Chinese restaurants with their nondescript brown sauces.

I decided to go full-blown veg there and ordered the $9.95 Garlic Meatless Chicken. It was deliciously hearty with big chunks of I-don't-know-what (seitan maybe?) tasting quite savory with a nice texture that really made me not miss the real thing. The meatless chunks were mixed with peppers and leeks, and I just think it's prepared with more panache than you would expect. I complemented that dish with the $8.95 plate of Garlic Pea Sprouts, a favorite of mine that I can never seem to find at Asian restaurants (last time was probably a trip to Le Cheval in Oakland). Even though there was probably a tad too much sesame oil in it, the freshness of the sprouts really satisfied my craving (see photo).

Along with some brown rice, that was it for my maiden voyage to Wonderland with no sign of the Mad Hatter unless you count the knit-capped street guy who rolled by the window with his squeaky shopping cart. But I'm definitely coming back and bringing Jamie W. along so we can order the Walnut Prawns or the Roast Duck. But alas, what am I thinking with our flexitarian diets staring at our bellies? Guess I'll take a deeper look at the Healthy Food Options section where there's enough steamed vegetable dishes to choke Richard Simmons. By the way, the service is buzzsaw-prompt with quite a few staff running around getting ready for the incoming parties who came after me. I agree that a Chinese restaurant this good should be patronized and frequently.

FOOD - 4 stars...surprisingly satisfying meatless options served here
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...still quite new and pretty spacious for the area
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...highly attentive
TOTAL - 4 stars...perhaps my body will be a wonderland if I continue eating meatless...in your face, John Mayer
author: Ed U.

description: The service has been great both times I've been here. Pretty standard Chinese- the soups are delicious and the food isn't greasy and oily, like someone else said.
author: Michelle M.

description: I must say this is the best Chinese food place I've been to in a while. I really don't like their availability/ hours, as they seem to be closed every other time I call them. Pros: Great food, great atmosphere, great selection, good pace. Cons: Their service is decent(average maybe), and take out is mediocre for some reason. Hands down my favorite so far!
author: Tendai M.

description:
Wonderland wasn't too memorable.

My friend and I ordered: Roasted Duck, Egg plant, and Beef Chow Fun. 

The Roasted Duck wasn't too moist, which was a bit disappointing. Although it was presented nicely and neat, the presentation didn't necessarily measure up. It didn't taste fresh.

The Beef Chow Fun, as well as the other dishes, all tasted a tad bit sour. It was a strange taste, but my friend agreed too. The egg plant wasn't the worst I have had, but it certainly wasn't the best. 

Overall, this place was a decent experience but I probably wouldn't be visiting this establishment again. The high prices simply don't merit the restaurant's food.
author: Chinsin S.

description: Husband and I only came here because we were in the area mid day, and nothing else was open nearby. Also, he has a fascination with why mainstream Americans have a thing for General Tso's chicken as we recently watched a documentary on the origins of this infamous general.  Needless to say, he ordered it, and I ordered the salmon with asparagus off the lunch menu. This is definitely nothing to write home about, however it is cheap and a slight step above Panda Express.
author: Tracy C.

description: Really delicious stuff, timely delivered. Would rate it 5, but would expect a bit more steam rice served. Definitely would reorder.
author: LandM S.

description:
Five stars for quality and quantity.

I can honestly say that I have never received such a large portion of quality Chinese for the prices here. AT and I placed one takeout order of General Tsao's chicken because we weren't too hungry. We were surprised to see that one order was as big as what we would have expected for two orders. Score--free leftover meal.

Note that the dishes do not come with rice, so make sure to order some on the side. They also stuff the rice carton to the brim.

I will definitely be back. I've found my go-to Chinese in the Haight area!
author: Julia N.

description: this is my go to delivery spot! they are efficient, affordable and tasty. I recommend the Wonton soup, spare ribs and basil chicken.
author: Sharon N.

description: Good Take-Out! Ordered on Doordash and it arrived before the scheduled time.  I got the West Lake Beef Soup, Sesame Chicken, Pork Chow Fun and Steamed Broccoli with Prawns. I liked the first three a lot. Fortune Cookies were on point.  Fresh and crunchy!
author: Andrew H.

description:
Excellent Chinese food!  Yes, their General Tso's is the bomb. However, for my taste, the glaze is sweet and I tend to like spicy or salty dishes more. 

4-Stars because they got an order wrong. My housemate ordered shrimp and meatless chicken with eggplant. We didn't get any shrimp. A guy named Ray said he'll give us a credit for future order, so I guess that's a plus. 

Overall, it's been pretty good so far and will definitely be a regular.
author: Drake D.

description: Wow I was this place's biggest fan until today. We ordered online at 10am for a 12:45pm delivery. It is now 1:15pm and we already called to receive a response of "it's almost there he left 5 mins ago". Five minutes ago?!? It was supposed to be here 30 mins ago. We gave them plenty of time to deliver our order and they did not come through. I hate to give these updates but this was bad.
author: Bri R.

description: This place is terrible.  We ordered food for 6 people they didn't give us an order for one of the people who also ordered an app(they missed her entire order), none of which came with our order.  We received no rice with our order, when we called and asked for them to bring our order that they missed as well as the rice they forgot the guy on the phone was so clueless he couldn't get us our food delivered to us in under a hour and couldn't figure out how to refund our order.  He kept saying we can "try" and refund your missed order...what does try mean we paid for food we didn't get our food we better get our money back.  This was the worst experience, we are visiting and the guy basically told us if we want our food we should drive and pick it up...we ubered it there and back, they refused to speed up the deliver from under 1 hours.  BEWARE OF THIS PLACE.  Terrible customer service, the good we received was sub par.
author: Paul M.

description: This place was very good. The service was a little slack due to the rush of hungry Haight citizens rushing to get off work and get a good bite to eat. The hot and sour soup was on point with tons of green onions on the garnish, just like I like it. I ordered the chicken with  green beans. The beans were crispy and the chicken was doused in garlic with a slight spicy aftertaste. It was a great experience.
author: Nate C.

description:
Wonderland is a wonderful Chinese restaurant situated on Fillmore & Haight. It is casual, consistent and has generous portions. What more could you ask for in a Chinese restaurant? Oh, and the food is not greasy. 

Try:
Beef and broccoli
Kung Pao Tofu (spicy)

I started to frequent Wonderland when I lived in the Lower Haight and it has remained my go-to restaurant for Chinese even after my move to Cole Valley.
author: Caroline L.

description:
I hate to admit it, but I think I like this place. 

As I drove by on my way to find parking, I found myself thinking, "Oh, god, this place is going to be dive-y as f**k." As I walked in though, I found myself completely wrong. Wonderland is hard to describe.  On the one hand, it is decorated with semi-exaggerated Oriental pieces, think dark wood furniture, red lanterns, red lights, you know, the type of restaurants they feature in Rush Hour, minus the not-so-secretly villainous waitresses and the chipaos... (I think). On the other hand, this place feels trendy, upscale, and even a little elegant.  It's hard to believe, but Wonderland does the whole "of-the-east" theme well- not a single jarring decoration in sight.  I thought it could never happen.

On to the food. We ordered the:
(+) hot and sour soup.
little heavy on the soy sauce, but it was still good.
(+) eggplant with spicy garlic sauce.
absolutely delicious. i love eggplant and this place delivers. you can ask them to make this dish more or less spicy as you wish.
(+)szechuan chicken.
solid. same note about the spice.
(+)chow fun w/ beef.
My friends thought this dish was a little bland, but I actually enjoyed it.  The noodles were nicely chewy and wasn't covered in oil (my biggest pet peeve). 

Notes: 
-service is ridiculously quick.  We barely started on our soup before everything else we ordered was already on the table.
-if you are craving Chinese food, but also want to have a conversation, come here! quality chinese food without all the yelling, clanking and crying babies. 
-The neighborhood around Wonderland is adorable- lower haight is almost completely different from what you normally associate with the Haight Ashbury area (although there are still a few reminders). 

I am absolutely coming here again and trying the other items on the menu. I am a little hesitant to say this, but I think this place might just be the Burma Superstar of Chinese food. 



Oh, one low light, how could I forget? Their non-fortune fortune cookies. "You are an artist. Let your colors show." What kind of fortune is that? :( It's not even predicting anything. The nerve.
author: Patricia K.

description: The best chinese food I've taste in San Francisco.
author: Maricarmen D.

description: Very good Chinese food in lower Haight neighborhood, General sauce chicken is outstanding.
author: Nicole D.

description: Wonderland is our go to Chinese takeout spot in the hood. They're quick and they deliver. Is the place gonna get Michelin stars? No. Will it satisfy your craving for decent Chinese Food that's a step above Panda Express? Yes. Order the avocado eggrolls, general tso tofu, dry fried green-beans, and fried rice. Can't go wrong.
author: Marky E.

description: i have only ordered  takeout  from them. delivery is very fast (usually faster than they promise). Food is very good but not outstanding. they use quality ingredients.
author: THOMAS H.

description: Still have yet to find a better and more consistent "American" style takeout Chinese spot in San Francisco. The owner is a great guy and the food and service are always on point. Can't really go wrong here.
author: Mike J.

description: Fast and friendly service. I had the general Tso's chicken and loved it. The prices are pretty reasonable too.
author: Joann T.

description:
So bummed to say that Wonderland has lost us as a dedicated (at least weekly) home delivery customer.  Last night we ordered via the website at 7:02pm - we live within 3 blocks of the restaurant.  The Site said our order would arrive by 8pm.  They always beat their delivery window estimate.  But, at 8:10 we started calling to see what was up.

So irritating that they took their phone off the hook, and decided it was better to not tell their customers they had gotten behind.  By 8:30pm (not being able to reach them) we bailed, and decided to make dinner.  

At 8:45 - nearly 2 hours after ordering, the delivery person rang the bell.  He then called my phone, then rang the bell, then the phone, then rang the bell 20 times!!!  (We figured they would understand the practice of not responding).

If only they had answered the phone, and told us to hang tight.  Better yet, they apparently had my number so how about a quick call to tell me they had gotten behind.  It would have been fine.  For all we knew, they had gone out of business or something.

Sucks that they decided to treat valuable customers in the way they did.  Bye WL.
author: Jim L.

description:
Mediocre food & bad service

I would avoid this place
author: David J.

description: Came here with my gf to grab dinner during our trip to SF. While her dish (salt and pepper meatless chicken) was fairly good, the sesame beef I got was atrocious. I thought I would enjoy this place, as it seemed to have fairly good reviews, but the beef I received was unpalatable; it was extremely rubbery, to the point where I could NOT take a proper bite out of it, and it was impossible to chew. While I welcome all of the meatless options here, I do not think I'll be coming back here again, and do not recommend getting the beef. Maybe the other dishes are better.
author: Alex C.

description:
Was craving some Chinese food while in San Francisco and found this place on Yelp. The food is exceptional for the price. My favorite was the Hong Kong chow mein; the best I've had in a while. It was only $9.25 for a very generous portion. Lost a star because I also ordered a veg with prawn but instead got chicken. I didn't mention it because I was so hungry and didn't want to wait to fix the issue. Tasted good anyway. 

Service was attentive-ish. Good enough for me!!
author: Jo L.

description:
This place is great! Came in for the lunch special, ordered two dishes since I couldn't decide, only about $16 for food, two helpings of rice, and soup. Tons of leftovers. I liked that I could get both prawns and chicken in the same dish so I didn't have to pick. Taste was great, sauce heavy and a bit on the sweet side, but that's typical. Green beans were great, crunchy and cooked just right. 

Restaurant was clean, well-lit with big windows, white tablecloths, nice wall art. Bathroom clean as well. Staff very friendly and accommodating.
author: Anon Y.

description:
This restaurant charged my card a additional 500.00 dollars on top of my meal by accident.  When I called to dispute the charge I spoke with Wang who was helpful and did refund every penny back to my account but not without bickering with me first.
First of all he still wanted to charge for my meal which should of been comped considering how much a inconvenience this matter was.  After he agreed to refund my money for the full amount after he only wanted to give me 50% off because I told him I would write a positive review on yelp he then still wanted to charge me city sales tax and delivery charge and was adamant about. I then explained that he will refund me the full amount that was charged to my card again. He then agreed... Needless to say I will never eat here again.
author: Timothy M.

description: Me and my boyfriend were staying only a couple blocks from the restaurant so we decided to call our order in and have it delivered. After telling the man who answered the phone the address he said they don't deliver to where we were and he hung up on me. Literally. My boyfriend called them back and asked why they wouldn't deliver to us and they just said it was too far. Literally a mile and a half away...Really? We really wanted Chinese food so I decided to just make the drive and go pick it up. When I go there the man behind the little bar was less then pleasant. He took my order and I waited. The food was ready pretty quickly and they brought it out to me when it was ready. I ordered it to go and they didn't have any utensils, napkins or condiments in the bag and when I asked for some forks and sweet n sour sauce the guy handed me 3 plastic forks. Just forks. They weren't in plastic. Or wrapped in napkins. Just forks. And he just gave me 1 little container of sweet n sour. It was like pulling teeth just to get those two things. So I didn't even bother asking for napkins, I just took all the napkins on the two closest tables to me and left. The service was the worst! Fortunately the food made up for such poor service. Although one thing we ordered was orange chicken and we were half way done eating it before we realized it wasn't orange chicken!!! Lmao!!! Ughhhh!!!
author: Ashley L.

description: I have a pretty strong stomach, and I had diarrhea about 1 hour after eating from here. I won't be eating their food again...
author: Matt B.

description: I ordered the walnut shrimp to go. Based on the items on the menu, what I ate and the location, this is good if you're expecting Chinese Amercian food. Close to $14 for about a dozen shrimps and $3 for large brown rice.
author: Gloria T.

description: Favorite Chinese Food place in SF.  Actually, ever.  The food is incredibly tasty and it's about as healthy as Chinese food gets - lots of fresh vegetables, not too much oil, just good good flavor.  Can't believe this doesn't have a higher standing in Yelp.  It is far above average.

Delivery is really fast. Food is pretty standard if not a bit above average. Their pot stickers are pretty large and flavorful, as are their vegetable spring rolls. My stomach felt somewhat questionable the morning after but hey, yummy yummy in my tummy tummy.
author: Peter T.

description: Do NOT order from here!!! I found hair in my food 4 times and they refused to do anything for me as a loyal customer. Then I ordered the shrimp and vegetables (I don't eat any red meat) and when I got to the bottom of the bowl, there was a huge piece of beef in the mix! Awful! They have zero concern for health standards and the food is absolute garbage. Stay away!!!!
author: Lori B.

description:
Ratings are as accurate as everyone describes. 

I honestly think that Chinese is the best bang for your buck when it comes to lunch menus. That's because for less than $10 you get a nice bowl of soup on top of the entree. Which is exactly what this place offers. Compare that to a tiny little sandwich you get from a food truck at OTG. Doesn't make any sense to me.

I ordered the Mongolian Beef, which for the first time tasted like Mongolian beef I had when I was a kid. Which has been a very long time. They do sort of a modern take on Chinese food by offering a nice salad with a little vinaigrette which compliments whatever you're ordering. I'm sold, will definitely come back here for future lunch excursions.
author: Eric L.

description:
I've had wonderland twice now. Once for delivery and once in the restaurant. I originally tried it out because the vegetarian menu reminded me of Big Lantern's vast meatless chicken selections. What's unfortunate about Wonderland is that, at least with the meatless orange chicken, no veggies come with it! Sure, I love fake fried chicken smothered in sauce, but I've got to have my veggies with it.

After ordering it for delivery the first time (and heating up frozen broccoli to go with it), I decided to ask for a side of broccoli when I ordered it in the restaurant. Apparently, a side of broccoli is only 4 pieces of broccoli! How sad :(

While the prices are pretty good for the amount of food you get, I'd like to see Wonderland start adding veggies to the meatless chicken dishes (or at least to that meatless orange chicken entree.) In the meantime, I guess I'll order it to-go and heat up my own broccoli.
author: Jon T.

description: Great local somewhat upscale place. Classy atmosphere. Very friendly service. Home delivery. Complex and intricate flavors. Fresh. Chow fun smooth and silky. Black pepper beef on sizzling plate tasty!
author: Josh F.

description: An hour and half into waiting for a delivery when the confirmation said it'd be here 45min ago. Called the restaurant just to hear the delivery person left 5min ago. There are many Chinese restaurants in SF that don't treat customers like crap and deliver just as decent quality food. I will not be ordering from wonderland ever again.
author: Boris B.

description:
Last night we ordered take-out from Wonderland Restaurant, and I do believe it was the best deal near Hayes Valley where we are staying. They delivered to us in less time than quoted, and for 2 people, $20 for a delicious dinner is perfection in my book.

My husband ordered General Tsao's chicken and vegetables, and asked them to steam the chicken instead of frying it, and I ordered the Chow Fun with Chinese BBQ Pork. It was all delicious. 

Their customer service was great, I will definitely support this business again.
author: Candida B.

description: Ordered dinner for delivery today. It's been 1hr and 15 mins. The food is not yet here. I tried calling the restaurant number both on Yelp and the restaurant website and it's going to a fax machine. All weird and disappointing. In the meantime, I have to figure out a dinner plan B for my family..
author: Manolo G.

description: So many Chinese places in the city it can be overwhelming.  Found Wonderland on Yelp. Don't miss this place!  Stopped on the way back from Haight.  It was misting so soup was in order.  Hot and sour soup was good, but the wonton soup is not to be missed.  Enjoyed the beef & broccoli, steamed chicken & mixed veggies with basil sauce (from the healthy menu)- all very good.  The pork potstickers with dipping sauce were out of this world!  Service was excellent - we were checked on often.  Seemed like a family owned business. Portions were huge.  Wish they would open a restaurant in Maryland!
author: Kristen H.

description: Portion sizes are HUGE. Two people could easily share 1 dish. Avocado egg rolls were good! Mushu Pork was delicious and way better than Mongolian Beef. Food was yummy, but very salty... Great service.
author: Tracy F.

description: 3.6 stars really. Good and quick take out service was ready in just 10 minutes. The general Tso's chicken was a little crispy for my taste, but had some nice and gentle heat. There was some broccoli, but not enough to balance the chicken. The wor wonton soup was chock-full of veggies chicken and shrimp, but oddly beef as well. Not used to that. The broth was also very dark, making it brown instead of yellow in color. Not sure if it was a beef broth or just chicken with a lot of soy sauce. Too much for my taste. And I still prefer the old-fashioned East Coast style wonton soup, but that's hard-to-find out here. C'est la vie. The steamed rice they charge you extra for which I think is a bit cheap on their part, but the food is actually pretty good so I'm willing to pay the extra two dollars.
author: David A R.

description:
I once wrote on Yelp that "If heaven exists, it's catered by Beard Papa's."

To that, may I add the following menu items from Wonderland:

Fried calamari - pillows of fried calamari deliciousness
Shredded pork with spicy garlic sauce - savory, spicy, garlicky - so good.

5-Spice Prawns - It's worth a muffin top or 8 extra hours on the elliptical, I am sorry.
Hot & Sour soup - It cured my cold and I do not know how (and it is delicious).

Dry Sauteed String Bean (with tofu) - Exceptional - and the only time I've liked tofu.
Honey Walnut Prawns - Ask WL for light sauce and it's...perfection.

Should I ever move away, I'm certain I'll need to go to rehab for Wonderland withdrawal. 

Delicious.
author: Jennifer O.

description: We dined in and the place is nice, food and service are really good. Prices are great! We deeply recommend you to try it!
author: Natalia C.

description:
Ahh Wonderland. I miss you.

We recently moved to Orange County and therefore have realized how good we had it with our local Chinese delivery in SF.

We have yet to find a place that serves General Tsao's or Orange Chicken as amazing as Wonderlands. The crispiness and thick sauce was definitely the appeal these dishes have at Wonderland over other chinese restaurants.

The service is quick and the delivery portions are easily enough to share with 2 people and have leftovers for a second meal. We would order General Tsao's Chicken, Beef Chow Mein, and fried Egg Rolls religiously and they always were two meals for the both of us. The fried rice is very tasty too.
author: Bethany S.

description:
(Take out only, 3 separate occasions)

1. salt/pepper prawns
- a bit heavy on the breading and not as crispy as a result 
- some may find it bland, but I appreciate the light hand with the salt 

2. Singapore style noodles 
- very bland, mostly coated in curry powder 
- little to no vegetables, mostly egg and few pieces of chicken 
- probably the most disappointing of dishes 

3. House special fried rice
- overwhelmingly single noted in flavor (aka Soy sauce) and slight bitter taste at the end (maybe b/c they added cilantro too early instead of topping it as a garnish?)
- would've preferred a little more complexity in terms of spice, but unoffending to most palettes 
-healthy portions for a group :) 

4. House spicy chow fun
- again, heavy with the soy sauce, not much else going on here 
- mostly fried egg, some beef and few bean sprouts; would've preferred a few more veggies/variety in spice/flavor profile 

5. Wonton soup 
- strangely heavy on the soy sauce (really expected more of a clear broth) 
- ended up discarding 

6. Kung pao chicken 
- overall solid dish
- i could quibble about the fact their peanuts were not toasted long enough and thus left a more a raw taste, but that's marginal for anyone who's just craving a hearty chicken dish 
- wished it was again, a little more bold in flavor (lacked any wow factor) 

Overall, generous portions and fresh tasting ingredients. Fair pricing and friendly staff. Nothing to write home about, but fine for a night in. For the neighborhood, I think it's solid takeout grub. If you want anything more, you're better off heading toward inner Richmond.
author: Laurie K.

description:
I'm never blown away by the food at Wonderland, but it is good comfort Chinese food at a low cost close to home. Also, the service is always quick and very friendly whether dining in or taking out.

As someone who used to order the General's Chicken (one of my favorites), I was pleasantly surprised when a veggie friend of mine ordered the Meatless (Tofu) General's Chicken and found it really delicious. Even better than the real chicken version they serve, which can be overly breaded. I recommend it.
author: Duke D.

description: We've enjoyed dining here twice for lunch, fresh food, nice selection, including healthy options with sauces on the side, the service is quiet but good too, we'll be back.
author: Ring Leader D.

description:
Had dinner delivered last night and the service is very efficient. The food was OK but not as good as the previous time I tried it, had too much oil in the noodles, the sweet and sour chicken felt like it was day old, and the kung pao chicken lacked zest. 
Maybe the chef just had a bad day, will give it another shot the next time I'm craving for Chinese food to be delivered.
author: Harshal V.

description: I frequent this place because it's close to my apartment. The food is fantastic, inexpensive, and very fast service. Great customer service and warm environment.
author: Anisa E.

description: The food arrived cold and late. The sesame beef was very fatty, the broccoli chicken had little taste and was stringy
author: Peter G.

description:
This was my girlfriend and my first time trying Wonderland. I was studying for finals and had a craving for Chinese food, so we had some delivered. We ordered using their online site and that was super easy and quick. The delivery took a little over an hour (a bit longer than the 45 minutes we were quoted).

Here's what we got:
Hong Kong Style Crispy Noodle with Beef: Pretty good. The noodles were separate from the sauce, veggies, and meat which was nice! A little too much sauce, but you can never go wrong with a little extra on the side. Flavor was good overall, noodles were nice and crispy!

Crab Rangoons: Too much cream cheese, not enough crab. It also didn't come with any sauce. Sweet and sour sauce would be nice. Not my favorite.

Orange Chicken: BOMB. It didn't look like i expected. It actually looked a little scary. It was dark and looked spicy, but it was amazing. Super crunchy, nice orangy flavor. Definitely will be getting this again.

This place will definitely be my go-to for Chinese delivery. It's gonna be very useful for my next set of finals!
author: Melyssa A.

description: A Chinese place that actually makes your lunch fresh and isn't massively greasy! And to boot, I asked for it spicy and they delivered. My new go-to Chinese restaurant.
author: Brian B.

description: My go-to Chinese take-out and delivery place. I love the General Tso's chicken, combination fried rice, and crab rangoon. It's definitely an American-Chinese restaurant, but sometimes that's what you want. Plus, fast delivery.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
New-ish Chinese restaurant in the Lower Haight that's great for cheap Chinese food. Unlike many quirky shops in SF, this place doesn't have any crazy decor that match the title. You would think the wallpaper would have Cheshire cats or there would be a tea party motif... Nope, methinks the owner just wanted something different than "House of X".

Went with a group of four and we split several dishes, all of which were quite tasty:
- Crab Rangoon (real crab and a hint of lemon) and sweet 'n' sour sauce
- Sesame beef
- Beef and broccoli (my personal fave at any Chinese restaurant)
- Spicy eggplant

Generous portions, lots of sauce and the best part? Our total bill was less than $45! Keep in mind that we only drank water since they don't have their liquor license yet (coming soon). But still, that's a lot of food for not a lot of money.

The restaurant is super clean and the owner visited our table more than once to make sure we enjoyed our experience. With the prices and quality, methinks they will have no problem sticking around this 'hood.
author: Abby S.

description:
Fantastic chinese food in Haight, in fact: some of the best I've had in the city.

Interior/Ambiance: Minimal, exceptional quality interior for the price point, dishware is all top notch (surprisingly); spot on. It's everything those fake gold white table cloth cheesy chinese restaurants wish they could be. 

Service: Very helpful, eager, positive staff, a pleasure to dine with.

Food: OMG. I am ecstatic this restaurant is in the Haight of all places. My Richmond Restaurant tourism just took a major hit. I can highly recommend (and btw I'm an avid carnivore):
* Spicy Garlic Eggplant (melts in your mouth)
* Mopu Tofu (Delicious savory dish, even if you don't normally eat tofu)
* Fake chicken dishes (can't even tell!)
* Beef & Chinese Broccoli (lots of leafy broc tops! delish!)

Price: 4 of us ordered lavishly, we paid $60.
author: jacob m.

description:
It kind of saddens me to write this as Wonderland has been my go to place for Chinese take out for awhile now, but within the last 6 months or so it's been extremely hit and miss. 

I'm being generous with three stars because I know when it's a hit, it's really delicious and would be at least 4-4.5 stars for what it is. 

I've ordered somewhere around 6-8 times in the last six months and have had way too many misses, even with ordering my usual items, vegetarian spring roll, General Tsoa Chicken, and Fried Rice. 

Delivery has never been quick, but if it tastes fresh and tasty I wouldn't complain. Over half the times I have ordered lately it has taken an hour or more for delivery and the food tastes flat and old. I don't know if it's because it's been in a delivery car for an hour or what it could be. The veggies in the dishes don't feel quite cooked and it's just really mediocre.

This could be a symptom of the whole restaurant, certain nights I've ordered, or maybe just my standards, but it really feels like the quality control has suffered and it's just not worth taking a chance anymore since I don't really know what I'm going to get.
author: Matt M.

description: Not as awesome as when first opened. Sauces have gotten too sweet. Meatless entrees more gooey in an unappetizing way. I would love to see a Chinese takeout offering organic veggies, as zucchini is mostly GMO these days and organic carrots and broccoli are so much better than non.
author: Michelina M.

description: Don't order through this Yelp page,  the prices are higher than ordering directly from the Wonderland website. Other than that, food was pretty tasty and fresh. Definitely will try again.
author: Mike C.

description:
Great food! Great service! Great prices! And very vegetarian friendly!
I had the string bean with fried tofu in garlic and salt.  The tofu was cooked really well and differently than I'm used to having.  The flavor was amazing and the perfect texture. My mom had the crispy chicken and although I didn't taste it (I'm vegetarian), she had excellent things to say about it.  The staff was very attentive and personable.  I very much enjoyed my experience and look forward to coming back!
author: Christine B.

description:
This is our go to for chinese delivery! I would say we get delivery at least 3 times a month and it never fails to disappoint.  If you are getting delivery, it always seems to take between 45 min-1 hour, so plan accordingly!

A couple of our staples are below:

Crab Rangoon: Super crispy, great proportion of cream cheese to fried wonton

General Tsos Chicken: Delicious, not greasy and always enough for lunch the next day. Also love the broccoli that comes with! 

Chicken Fried Rice: Perfectly seasoned and again always enough for a second meai

Seafood, basil and eggplant dish: Great sauce and the eggplant is always cooked perfectly
author: Sara S.

description: The wait for pickup can be very long and unpredictable. After waiting 30 minutes, they told me they would make my food starting then. When I protested, I was rudely told to "look around and see how we busy we are". Not very neighborly.
author: Mark P.

description:
Amazeballs! That's how I would describe both the General Tso's Meatless Chicken and the Orange Meatless Chicken. They are delicious little balls of vegan goodness! 

I also ordered the Basil Tofu which was great. It surprised me because it seems like something that you would find in a Thai (rather than Chinese) restaurant. The tofu is firm and chewy is cooked with basil, red peppers, zucchini and mushrooms. The sauce is the best part, savory and not too spicy. 

With lots of vegetarian/vegan options on their menu, I will definitely be going back soon and often.
author: Kelly L.

description: Best Chinese in the city, period. Great delivery as well. We now live in Orange County and there is nothing here that compares. Wonderland has an amazing selection of vegan options as well. I would highly recommend them to anybody in the mood for some amazing Chinese food.
author: David H.

description:
Website states that they deliver in a 2 mile radius of the restaurant. This is incorrect. They apparently don't deliver past Van Ness and California.

The guy I was talking to on the phone was very unfriendly and stated I could either cancel the order or come pick it up, because they don't deliver past Van Ness. When I tried to explain that I was just a block away from Van Ness (on 10th), he cut me off and said he would just refund me, said thank you, and hung up.

The food may be good, but the staff is very inconsiderate.
author: Cody H.

description:
In my previous review, I gave this place 5 stars.  But I took a STAR off (and I might take another) because of this waiter that works there.  He always seems to be rude on the phone (especially on the phone) when I'm calling for pick up or delivery.  When I'm inside eating, it just seems like he doesn't care.  
He's pretty tall, on the bigger side with glasses but I love the other staff that works there, especially the owner.  But little by little, that guy is just starting to make me NOT want to go back.
Whatever!
author: Little E.

description:
I don't crave Chinese food often (aside from Mission Chinese), but when I do, I typically order from Wonderland. It's very convenient and they also do delivery, which is great for when I don't feel like walking 4 blocks down Haight Street.

The restaurant itself is really nice. I've never eaten there before, but from what I've seen during pickup, it's a lot cleaner and nicer than most American Chinese restaurants.

The food has just been ok. It's gotten better over the years, but I don't think it's that great. I do have to admit, the crispy green beans and fried tofu with garlic is amazing. I could probably just order that from now on and be happy. Their potstickers are embarrassingly AWFUL. For some reason they keep using this incredibly thick and chewy skin. The first two bites out of the pot sticker have zero meat or filling, all you're eating is chewy dough. Please please change your wrapper for pot stickers. I would be ordering takeout from Wonderland more often if they changed this one thing.

I've also had their won ton soup and hot and sour soup. Both pretty good, but nothing special. One time I ordered their pea sprouts and it was almost inedible. Really grassy, chewy pea sprouts compared to what I've had elsewhere.

Again, it's mediocre Chinese food, and worth ordering from if you don't feel like cooking.
author: Michelle N.

description: I used to really like this spot, but after seeing that they scored in the bottom 5% of all restaurants in SF for food safety, I will not be going back.  Really too bad. I hope they can clean up their act. Literally.
author: N T.

description:
The mongolian beef was good but spicy so be carful ;) 

The hot sour soup was tasteless.  

Delivery time was less than 30 minutes.
author: Omer S.

description: Great chinese in SF. Hard to find a good takeout place, but this is one of the best. Ask for White Meat and try the Salmon/Asparagus! Never have eaten there, only takeout. Great, fast service.
author: Brent T.

description:
This place is excellent!  It takes a special kind of Chinese food for me to pay a Postmate or drive myself over to pick it up. Wonderland is that kind of food; I've ordered a number of times and have never been disappointed.

Things that are delicious:

Avocado Spring Rolls - you can't beat these delicious fried treats! The avocado is warm and creamy, the roll is crispy, but not greasy and the veggies are fresh!

General Tsao's Chicken - this is my husband's favorite! Crispy, perfect amount of sauce, super juicy pieces of chicken

BBQ Pork Chow Fun - love the wide noodles and the BBQ pork is outstanding!

We've also had the garlic pea shoots, wontons, fried rice and basil chicken.  Yum yum!

The only thing that would make it better is if they delivered to the 94118!
author: Jamie D.

description:
This place was decent, but I wouldn't give it 4 stars. 

Hot & Sour Soup - Good (and complimentary)
Chow Fun - Have had better
Pea Sprouts w/ Garlic - had too much stem, not enough garlic, and tasted like grass
Salt and Pepper Shrimp - Great

The check also comes with a fortune cookie and a piece of gum :)

Probably wouldn't go back, but it was alright to try for lunch.
author: Leslie C.

description:
I have only tried this restaurant once and I will come back and maybe change this 3 star rating - but this is a perfect example of a 3.5 star restaurant. Fresh ingredients but execution errors...

1. Crab Rangoon - my guilty pleasure - crisp, nice batter, large amounts of stuffing - but mostly cream cheese with very little crab - or fake crab to be fair.
2. Schezuan Fish - SOOO - this has no red chili in it so I take issue with it being called Schezuan - which brings up images of bright red, barely can heat hotness - that said it was delicious and the fish was much fresher and quality than in most chinese restaurants - it is in more of a black bean/garlic sauce with jalapenos added in for a bit of spicy
3. Salt and Pepper Shrimp - My favorite classic - salt and pepper anything!!! If I had even remotely liked this one then I think it would be a full 4 star rating - but this was bad - REALLY thick batter, not cooked all the way through and very little flavor - Again the shrimp was obviously quality

I see why the prices are a little high and hope they continue to use the quality ingredients - they just need to brush up on their execution skills.

Order came in typical 40 minutes and they didn't forget my drink - so that's worth something!
author: Kendra W.

description:
Upscale decor in an otherwise very trashy street.

The servers here are very polite and very prompt with their service, really digging the vibe.

They have a small section in the menu dedicated to spicy foods, very happy they included this as I absolutely love spicy foods.

Definitely coming back here.
author: Vayne K.

description:
I grew up in Chinese restaurants so suffice it to say that I've had enough crab rangoon and egg rolls to last a lifetime. It's comforting to have an excellent stand-by in my neighborhood that serves up familiar dishes that I remember fondly from childhood. That said, nobody beats my dad's Singapore-style vermicelli rice noodles ;)

My Wonderland favorites include the pork potstickers (pan-fried but the wrapper is still deliciously chewy), wonton soup (the large order generously feeds at least 2-3 adults as it's chockfull of crisp veggies, prawns and meaty wontons...nomnomnom), and basil eggplant with chicken and prawns. I'm always impressed by how fresh the ingredients taste, and it's never overly greasy.

The tofu salad is a non-traditional dish that includes mixed greens topped with crispy, deep-fried tofu. The lunch specials are a pretty good deal too and the portions are always generous. The funny thing is, I've only ever gotten takeout here -- never dined in -- although the dining room looks very pleasant and clean. Thanks, Wonderland for always dishing it up hot, fast and fresh!
author: Jenny N.

description: Wednesday night and we wanted some Chinese take out. The won ton soup was fantastic. Lots of goodies in there as opposed to just liquid. The general tsao was delicious. We also ordered chow fun and vegetables. A very solid place for standard Chinese food.
author: brian p.

description:
Very rude service from manager.  

We tried to order for delivery and their policy is not to deliver past stanyan.  When I asked if they could consider expanding the range in the future for an additional delivery charge or at their discretion when not busy (currently the computer limits the radius), the manager became argumentative and refused to even convey the request to the owner.  He seemed scared of communicating customer service requests.  Not a healthy work environment or customer service orientation.  

I'm fine with setting rules, but a manager should listen and consider requests from his clientele. Even if they later are dismissed as not good business.  

I left the call with a very bad taste in my mouth.
author: Stephen R.

description: I'm a fan!!!  Good food that's is done right.  You will enjoy this place!!!!!    My fav is the Hong Kong noodles!!
author: Kareem J.

description:
We drive all the way across town for Wonderland when we're craving Chinese food. We're vegan, and they are incredibly good with vegan options. 

Our favorite dishes are General Tsao meatless chicken, basil fried tofu (omg yum), and the vegetable chow fun. Make sure you tell them vegan/no egg! This stuff melts in your mouth!

We usually come here with mixed groups, because they please the meat eaters too!
author: Nick W.

description:
Wonderland has a fairly interesting menu, which generally seems friendly to vegetarian and health conscious eaters. I did not try any items from those sections of the menu, but I do appreciate that they actually have a section for meatless-meat and "healthy food". That said, the rest of the menu seems like pretty standard American style Chinese food. 

Coming from the Triangle in North Carolina, I may have been expecting too much with San Francisco's reputation as a foodie town, but Wonderland is about the same as  the American style Chinese restaurants we have in NC. I ordered the West Lake Beef Soup, Chow Mian, and Pork Cutlet dishes. The server must have misunderstood the order, because the soup that came out was a spicy tomato-based soup full of seafood. When we asked about it, he said he thought we wanted a spicy soup and brought this one instead of the less spicy beef version (what?). Aside from that, the Chow Mian and Pork dishes were very good but also fairly standard. 

The pork cutlet is served as chopped chunks on the bone, and cooked in a thick plum sauce. The Chow Mian seemed less greasy than a lot of places I've had it, and it had a nice variety of fresh ingredients. I'm not sure what soup I ended up with, but I did appreciate that the waiter portioned it out for us at our table. The tomato-based soup was spicy and pretty tasty, and I liked the chunks of fish. I could probably do without the imitation crab, but there were also shrimp and scallops in the soup. 

I was hoping to find an authentic style restaurant, but those restaurants seem to be either out in the suburbs or in the downtown area. That said, Wonderland is going for American-style food and they do a pretty good job with it.
author: Mark W.

description:
I haven't posted a review in years but my migraine was bad enough to emerge to write this. 

I am very familiar with Chinese cooking and can definitely tell when MSG is used. I just returned from a two week journey across Latin America for work, and was excited to order from wonderland again.

The food is tasty and savory and fast and easy but so laden in with MSG that I couldn't feel my tongue afterwords. The next morning I awoke with a throbbing head and sound / light sensitivity which lasted for 2 days. 

Bottom line, despite how tasty the food is, if you have a sensitivity to MSG or migraines avoid this place like the plague.
author: Brit C.

description: I came here on Chinese New Year with my friend because I had to go eat noodles and chicken because it was New Years. I loved everything we got. I'm not sure if we just got lucky but it was all really good. I highly recommend this place. It's a bit more "American-ized" though so if you're looking for traditional this is not the place to go.
