The staff is really sweet and nice. It was easy to get a table around 7 on a Friday night. I didn't try them, but I was super surprised how vegetarian friendly this place was. They had a ton of meatless options. Parking though is a bit difficult I will say so if you muni it here, that's probably more ideal as it took me a long time to find any parking.
author: Julie L.

description:
This review is long overdue - favorite restaurant in Lower Haight! Eating inside and takeout (both ordered online and through the phone) has always been delicious and satisfying. But we love going in to eat because the employees are extremely kind! I love supporting their business, they deserve it.

We've gotten to try lots of things here and there since its opening. Here's a rundown of my favorites

1. Basil Eggplant w/ Prawns & Chicken - flavorful and a great combination!
2. Walnut prawns - not a dish I recommend to have as your own plate because it is sweet if that's all you're eating (I don't mind it, but know others might). Wonderful in combination with  many other plates when eating with a large group.
3. Dry braised meatless chicken - yummy and interesting flavor. They're like meatballs!
4. Broccoli beef - classic takeout, always good.
5. General Tsao chicken - crunchy fried chicken, very delicious.
6. Vegetable Brown fried rice - THE BEST, we get this every single time.

I love sticking to my favorites, and want to try some new choices soon.
author: Eli P.

description: consistently great food, never overly oily or greasy, service oriented.  it's become my go to for eat in and take home chinese.
author: Arthur S.

description:
Fantastic food, excellent service.

We had the eggplant, hong-kong style noodles, vegetarian dumplings, chicken and broccoli, and soup.  Everything tasted sooo good. I love this place.

Environment also has great energy with tall ceilings and pleasant painting as a centerpiece. 

Prices are also reasonable. We will return soon.
author: M E.

description: The dumplings & General Tsao's tofu get a score of dank. Everything else scored a shwiggity shwag :(
author: Tommy T.

description:
Holy Vegetarian Chinese Heaven! AMAZING fake chicken General Tsao's! I have never had General Tsao's before, because I've been a vegetarian since I was 14. My companion ordered this dish and he said it was "pretty close to the real thing". The fake chicken wasn't too like real chicken, which for me was a major plus. Very big menu, which makes me wonder, but it turned out to be far and away the best meal we ate in San Francisco. We did order the side of rice (extra $) but it was really unnecessary. 

I ordered the kung pao fake chicken. It was quite good, but after tasting the General Tsao's I pretty much abandoned my dish. 

Service was extremely prompt. We ordered the General Tsao's a few days later as carry out. My only complaint was that they were skimpy on the vegetables. Both times I ordered a side of steamed broccoli, and this ended up being 2 pieces the first time and no pieces the second time.

Note: No complimentary sweet and sour soup. (Other reviews say there is).
author: Sadie T.

description:
Finally found delicious Americanized Chinese food since moving to SF. I had Mongolian Beef, husband had veggie Moo Shoo. Our waitress was unable to accommodate his request to put the Meatless Chicken into the Moo Shoo. 

Affordable, quick service, delicious. Will come again.
author: Blair S.

description:
We tried Wonderland for the second time this weekend, and I am now a convert. I think I found my new it's-Friday-night-and-I'm-too-exhausted-to-go-out go-to spot!

Here's our meal breakdown:

-Sizzling rice soup: 3.5 stars for clean, fresh but not super developed flavors.
-Eggplant and basil (with prawns & chicken): 5 stars for flavors I will be dreaming about with just the right amount of spice.
-Mu shu pork: 4 stars for a solid, greaseless rendition of a classic.
-Brown fried rice with BBQ pork: 5 stars for the best healthy(ish) fried rice ever!

Our service was fast and attentive as well: Our appetizer came within a few minutes of ordering, and the rest of the food followed suit in about 10 minutes.  And while I'm not of the veggie persuasion, the meatless chicken options on the menu make Wonderland a great spot for my meatless friends!
author: Darcy O.

description:
Wonderland offers up some surprisingly healthy but otherwise standard Chinese food accompanied by a smattering of some Golden Era-esque faux-meat dishes.  I thought the prices to be reasonable, portions are large, and the service is good - not a restaurant worth traveling across the city for but a good option for Chinese if you are in the area.  

Food-wise two dishes I would recommend are the Sizzling Rice Soup and the Szechuan fish.  The soup was probably the most interesting dish of the night - they serve up with a bit of flair (the waiter comes by douses the puffed rice in the scalding hot soup) and it turned out to be simple but good.  Our next favorite was the Szechuan fish - the flavors were good, veggies crisp, and dish void of massive amounts of oil and msg.  

A dish to avoid is the faux-meat Orange Chicken.  While the sauce is pretty good, the fake chicken leaves something to be desired, coming in heavily fried and very uniformly shaped spheres - I would not be surprised if they got the fake meat frozen or canned from May Wah in the Richmond.  I think what really throws the dish off is that each piece has too much fake meat and too little sauce - they need some non-spherical fake meat so that there's more nooks and crannies for the sauce to cling to.  Ahem...a higher surface area to volume ratio, if you will...that's right, I just dropped a little geometry in my review.  

All in all a decent choice for Chinese but my search continues for a great Chinese restaurant in SF!
author: Rosers M.

description:
We ordered: 
1) Sizzling Rice seafood soup was Excellent, Contained a generous amount of shrimp, chicken, fresh mushroom, and green beans. Could have used a little bit of bok choy or some other vegetables.
2) Chicken with Broccoli and extra cashews & black mushrooms. it was excellent. But, we got fresh mushrooms instead of black mushrooms.
3) Salmon with asparagus in black bean sauce was excellent. I would have used a little less oil. But, I'm not as young as I used to be.
4) Mu Shu Chicken was Excellent. Pan cakes stayed in one piece but were not too thick. Mixture of cabbage, wood ear, carrots, etc. was properly cooked - almost no liquid.
**We were stuffed and also had enough left overs for another meal.
Total price including 15% tip was $56.50.
Highly recommended!
author: Andrew S.

description: The lunch special is our favorite and they serve lunch on Saturdays which is when we frequent.  If you dine in they give you a soup, salad, rice and your entree.  Our 3 favorite dishes are kung pao shrimp, beef with green beans and general tsaos chicken.  Great service and the carryout is a good option too but no salad with the to go and the salad is a great balance to the meal.  They also give you a fortune cookie and a piece of gum at the end, how cool is that!
author: Alison K.

description: Came to wonderland for some fresh healthy Chinese. And I was not disappointed at all. Unlike other Chinese restaurant with fatty meats and oily noodles the general tao chicken and vegetable chow mein was cooked to perfection. Fresh veggies perfect meat. Will definelty return with the boo thang again. Next time I'll order the Mongolian beef maybe even lunch special.
author: Chenea P.

description:
Scrumptious! I'm not even a Chinese food guy. 

They have options for both lean & comfort dishes. Efficient, and reliable.
author: Brandon J.

description:
This is my favorite Chinese Restaurant in San Francisco.  It reminds me of Chinese food on the East Coast, which for some reason just tastes different.

The General Tso's is amazing, as is their Hot and Sour soup.  The staff is very kind and the restaurant is nice and roomy.  I try to eat here whenever I'm in the city.
author: Ethan B.

description:
Better then your typical Chinese restaurant. In-between 3 and 4 stars. 

I got the  Basil Eggplant w/ Prawns & Chicken which was very tasty. Good flavor and a good size portion. For an appetizer I got the B.B.Q. Pork. It was flat slices of pork. Was hoping for a little more flavor, maybe thicker pieces. Will come back again, maybe try some different options and give it another try.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: Unapologetically American Chinese food, done well.  Got the scallion pancakes, kung pao chicken, and Mongolian beef between two people.  Everything was very good.  The portions were large enough that there was a full serving remaining for leftovers.
author: Simon L.

description: I was always a fan of Chinese food, but after I decided to become a vegetarian I lost a lot of options, specially because not a lot of Chinese restaurants worry a lot about vegetarian options. When I went to Wonderland for the first time, seeing the meatless chicken menu excited me, but at the same time, I didn't know what to expect, fake meat can be disappointing. Turns out it is AMAZING! The texture and the taste are perfect, I was even a little suspicious that it might be real chicken :P I was really happy to find such a great place for vegetarian Chinese food!
author: Beatriz B.

description:
The Chinese food here is delicious and the service is great. The restaurant has big windows and is in a corner location so there is a lot to see.

We had the vegetarian fried rice, the kung pao meatless chicken, the spicy eggplant with shrimps and scallops, and the hot and sour soup.

My wife and I were both impressed with the meatless chicken dish and the spicy eggplant dish. Both had lots of fresh vegetables and tasted as good as I can imagine.

We brought a bottle of wine and paid the $10 corkage which we thought was reasonable.

I would definitely return here to try more things!
author: Tomas P.

description:
I just moved to the Bay Area about 2 months ago, but had discovered this gem back in January and am now just getting to reviewing it.  I have been here several times now, and without a doubt, has the best vegetarian Chinese food a veggie lover could ever ask for! 

They are consistent with their food each time I've gone.  General Tsao Meatless Chicken is freakin' heaven! Love the Garlic Pea Shoots too. Serving sizes are generous, enough so, that i can take it home and have it for lunch the next day.  

The service has also been consistent as well.  

I will defiantly be going back here for my occasional Chinese food cravings!
author: Sabrina T.

description: Came here with a veg friend so we went that route and I was fairly pleased. The general tso's fake chicken tasted pretty good, which honestly isn't superhard to do. Fried fake chicken with sauce is hard to mess up. We also had the double mushroom bok choy dish. Another standard that came out just fine.
author: Misha T.

description: Good Chinese food.  Delivery guy rocks.  Guy that takes the order rocks.  I've been ordering from wonderland for a while now and they have never messed up an order!!  Not one
author: Mac B.

description:
So you can order and pay for delivery...ONLINE!

So maybe I'm behind the times and a lot if places are doing this...but I have rarely seen this before and think its awesome! My friend and I were super lazy and just wanted to stay in and watch a movie so we ordered online. 45 minutes later the food was hot and sitting on our table. 

We ordered:

Sweet and sour prawns: pretty darn good! Excellent flavor, tasted fresh. 

Vegetarian Mu Shu: it tasted really good, but to be honest I'd never had Mu shu before so I can't judge very well. But my friend said it was great by her Mu shu standard. 

Avocado spring rolls: by far my favorite. Absolutely delicious! 

I haven't eaten at the restaurant but I'm a fan because if their bomb delivery situation!
author: Eli Y.

description:
WOW! and what a find, great chinese food and they DELIVER!

after years of finding NO decent delivery chinese anywhere close to hayes valley, i discovered WONDERLAND via yelp.

the food is incredible, delicious and fresh - ive not had a bad meal there yet, so im going to just keep on ordering until ive tried everything im remotely interested in.
some of my old favorites are made here but theyre tasting even better than i remember.

online ordering is EASY and you can pick a time you want it delivered, what a novel concept.

i would hate to choose just one dish to review because everything has been so tasty.  my ONLY minor complaint?  boy, they sure give you a a lot of food for your money!  being single, its hard for me to finish everything i order, so im learning to order wisely.  the fried rice was savory but far too much, when you order an entree and appetizer, so ill stick to steamed rice until i have guests over.

they have a great location, haight and fillmore and i want to try eating there sometime.  i cant recommend this place enough - try it, youll like it!  or LOVE it, in my case.  hooray for WONDERLAND - total 4.5 BIG stars from me

UPDATE - may '14
sadly, for me, this place has gone downhill very quickly and im sad.  i was ordering regularly and then got an funky meal - the shredded pork.  chalked it up to just a bad selection but i dumped almost all of it as inedible.

the next few times just never brought the same quality food and then the fried prawns, 3 times in 3 different orders, came tepid and mealy...one of my faves before but not worth spending money on anymore.

so im not sure if they had a change in cooks or management but something isnt the same.  ill not give up on this place but im going to wait a few months and maybe check it out again.  i DO tho have to drop them from 5 stars to 3 - for now.
author: Miguel D.

description:
I came here for dinner with friends while in town for job prospects.  I was promised big portions of tasty Chinese food for a fair and reasonable price.  And boy, did Wonderland deliver.

While the decor leaves a lot to be desired, Wonderland offers oversized portions of Chinese favorites with plenty of vegetarian and meatless options.  I particularly enjoyed the chow fun with BBQ pork, as well as the meatless General Tso's chicken.  I also liked the double mushroom with bok choy.  The salt and pepper tofu, however, was just ok.  Between the five of us at $15 per head with plenty of food to feed us all, this place is a steal.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for no-frills Chinese fare that's big on taste and easy on the wallet.
author: Barrett L.

description:
Hell yeah, Wonderland - now I know why Peter Pan never left! Best American Chinese delivery I've ever had.  Four times we've ordered and the guy taking orders never messes up, the food is never late, and it is always delicious comfort food. Tastes vary, but six different folks have all agreed it's great, and a good value to boot! 

Orange Beef
General Tso's Chicken
Ginger Chicken
Pork Fried Rice
Beef Chow Mein
Sweet &  Sour Pork
Garlic Chicken
some sort of Broccoli 

All have been good with large, quality ingredients, nice containers, condiments, chopsticks, and delivered hot. Seriously, when leftovers are good... WHAAAAT?!
author: Avery A.

description:
Dear fellow Yelpers,

Pretty much everything on their menu will tug at your heart strings! But the Chicken Wings!!???  Oh Lord Jesus! Amen Hallelujah!!!!!  I clutched my imaginary pearls at first bite and chyle I'm STILL on a high as I type this up. 

Service has always been great and they really know how to throw down in the kitchen. I give this jewel of a place five stars for all around excellence.

Thanks Wonderland for settin my heart N soul on Fire once again!
author: Dallas S.

description:
They do wonderful things at Wonderland.  I use them for pickup and delivery all the time and they have become my go-to restaurant in the neighborhood.  It is so good to see a quality restaurant occupy that building after so many duds over the last few years.

The food is fast, affordable and always high quality.  I highly recommend the won ton soup, the large is enough for 3 meals on its own.  The potstickers are always done to perfection and they have a ton of veggie options too.

In short, always good, always fast, reasonable prices.  Check these guys out.
author: Cheezy P.

description: I wandered down Haight from a bar that didn't serve food, and happened on Wonderland. I chose the Black Pepper Beef Sizzling Plate  and it turned out to be one of the best Chinese meals I've ever eaten. It was very reasonably priced, the beef was tender, and I had enough left over for lunch the following day. I'd be a regular if I didn't live in Seattle.
author: Peter Y.

description:
I can only speak to the delivery - this is our go-to spot in the neighborhood to combat Sunday night blues with delicious Chinese takeout on the couch. 

The food is fresh and tasty and doesn't leave me in a coma or feeling ick post nom like some Chinese food does. A vegetarian friend turned me onto their meatless General Tso and now I order that instead of the regular. The avocado spring rolls are a bit too greasy for my taste, but I liked the concept.  Portions are generous and we often use our leftover Wonderland to curb Monday evening blues as well. 

Delivery is always friendly, but can be a tad slow on busier nights.
author: Tory F.

description:
So the definition of 2-stars, according to Yelp, is "Meh, I've experienced better." That is exactly how I felt about Wonderland. I placed an order last night for pickup. The woman told me it would be ready in 15 minutes, so I arrived in 15 minutes. I had to wait an additional 15 minutes. Bummer. 

The pot-stickers were terrible. I was so excited for them and they let me down. They were oversized and super doughy (and greasy). Didn't seem like they were made there, but rather, purchased in bulk by a Chinese food distribution company. The papaya salad was terrible.... mostly lettuce, lacking flavor; no sauce or seasoning.  The shrimp that came on it were shelled, but never cleaned. I had to wash and clean them before eating them. It was kind of gross. The mu-shu pork was pretty good, but there were huge chunks of green onion/scallions in there, that were impossible to eat. It's like they were too busy to chop them up into bite-size pieces. We just had to pick them out. Lastly, I ordered the onion pancakes. They were ok; very thick and greasy...so they tasted good, but were pretty unhealthy. 

The servers were nice and the place seemed clean. I was really disappointed with the food and don't have any plans to return.
author: Jake B.

description:
Delicious american style Chinese food!
I always come here for their lunch specials. Kind of the best time to come here otherwise the meals get pricey if you're ordering for two. If you come here for the lunch specials not only is it cheaper but it also comes with soup and rice. At dinner the entrees do NOT come with rice unless you pay extra... Or at least the guy on the phone always asks me if I want to add rice.. That's why this place is only 4 stars for me.

I recommend the general tso's chicken and the chicken and vegetables. Very good quality food, great customer service, and it is prepared very quickly. Also the interior is very nice for dining. My favorite Chinese food in the area. Mmmm
author: Jennifer H.

description:
'S Wonderful. 'S Marvelous. 'S Wonderland*.

This is an exceptionally good neighborhood Chinese restaurant in a neighborhood that has sorely needed one for the nearly 30 years we have lived here. Once the Lower Haight gets a top-notch, old-school Italian restaurant, we will become a fully contented and fully self-contained community of Hyper-Locavores.  

The top pick at Wonderland is Salt and Pepper Triple Delight, which is delicately battered and deep-fried shrimp, calamari and scallops - though it tends to go heavy on the calamari, which is the cheapest ingredient next to the batter.  On two visits, the dish was perfectly executed, served plenty hot and plenty plentiful. 

Speaking of delights, we also were pleased with the special eggplant and shrimp, Beijing noodles, Mongolian beef, Szechuan lamb and dry-braised green beans.  Portions are generous and pricing is reasonable for a corner restaurant with white tablecloths, pleasant decor, always-cold beer and normally efficient table service. Though the pleasant servers sometimes get backed up on a Saturday night when the place is packed and the to-go telephone is ringing like crazy, we would rather wait a bit longer to pay the tab than be hustled though a mediocre meal. 

On the subject of pacing, we found on our first visit that the food came blasting to the table nearly all at once - appetizers and mains jammed side by side with no space left on the table, our plates and our over-stimulated palates.  On the second trip, we asked to have the Triple Delight as an appetizer - as the green-onion cakes and pot stickers are not special enough to waste the dough on these dough-centric calories - and to bring the rest of the order later as our main.  

The waiter gave us a short headstart on the starter and we gobbled as fast as we could, but we still had to scoop the last bits of seafood off the serving plate to make room for the main course. While we will continue to encourage him to perfect his timing, nothing but triple-bypass surgery will prevent us from ordering the Triple Delight on every future visit. BTW, we fear this dish may not travel well for takeout and home delivery.  Get off the couch and dine here in person.   

When we asked to meet the owner, Wayne, to thank him for coming to our neighborhood, he could not have been more pleasant.  He even brought us a pair of complementary mango mochis for dessert. 

Eat well, be nice to Wayne and get a treat. What's not to like?  Now, if only he had an Italian cousin...  

* Our remix of " 'S Wonderful" by George and Ira Gershwin, who wrote the song for the 1927 Broadway play "Funny Face,"  which goes in part:

'S wonderful, 's marvelous
That you should care for me!
'S awful nice, 's paradise,
'S what I love to see.'
author: Alan M.

description: Consistently good Chinese food, great portions and fast service great place in the haight to grab lunch or dinner. The lunch special is awesome comes with soup again very large portions
author: Ribec F.

description: Really loved this place. Went back and forth between this and Brandy Ho's. My wife wanted to try Wonderland and she hit a homerun. Everything was stellar. Fantastic.
author: Josh L.

description:
This is the best chinese I have had in SF. Far from a greasy spoon they use fresh ingredients and offer healthy options to staple dishes like BROWN fried rice, ll WHITE MEAT Gen. Tsos chicken and the wonton soup is amazing, I am not even a huge chinese food fan but this place stands out because of the fresh ingredients and how "clean" the food was. i.e.- not covered in grease

MUST TRY: WON TON SOUP
author: L V.

description: I've lived right next door to Wonderland for a couple years now and have ordered from here more than I care to admit (primarily take out, but I've eaten there a couple of times too). Our go-to's are Fried Brown Rice, General Tsao chicken and Basil Eggplant w/ Prawns & Chicken. Their Wor Wonton Soup is fantastic too - really dark rich broth with lots of veggies. Other good dishes are the pork potstickers, green beans and tofu (better had at the restaurant vs. take out), Walnut Prawns and Mongolian Beef. I probably wouldn't travel across the city for it, but it's a well above average neighborhood restaurant. Some silly Chinese food restaurant tried opening up across the street with a nearly identical menu and horrible food, but closed within a couple months. It's pretty hard to compete with Wonderland.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Delivery was prompt and friendly. I used their online ordering service which worked pretty well. I know the owner is reading this, so I would like to request that the online menu contain descriptions of the food. I was not familiar with one dish and on a recommendation here on Yelp, i tried it. As promised, it was delicious, but was way too sweet and deep fried. I love it, but it was like eating a donut for dinner. General Tsao Meatless Chicken.. Recommended if you enjoy sweet, mildly spicy Chinese food.  Anyhow, pleas e provide a description of the food and if possible a picture of the item.

I will order from Wonderland again. I need to try and find more healthy food next time..

Oh, for the Yelpers out there.. It's a tiny bit more expensive than expected, but that might be related to the delivery service overhead.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I've walked past this place several times but didn't think of trying it until my friend mentioned how good it was. They deliver, and you can order online through their website--awesome for people like me who enjoy being a hermit sometimes.

I like that they offer a variety of meatless dishes. I tried the general's meatless chicken but found that it was a tad too sweet for my taste. Pretty good nonetheless, and I look forward to trying more dishes in the future. I find that the chow mein is the best I've had so far in the city. It's actually really hard to find good Chinese food.

This is definitely my delivery pick for Chinese from now on.
author: Ringo M.

description:
The Best Wor Wonton Soup I've ever had--delicious broth, with HUGE wontons, and shrimp, beef, chicken. Also Basil, shrimp and chicken--delicious.
I was a bit intimidated with the fancy tablecloths, but the food is super yummy and the staff friendly.
author: Lisa K.

description:
This place is fantastic!  After getting bad delivery Chinese food tonight from Hai Sun, I felt compelled to highlight the great work that these restauranteurs are doing.  

I've not yet ordered delivery from them yet, but I will be trying them the next time that I do.  Meanwhile, I have had several excellent dine-in experiences.  

I especially recommend going there for lunch - even for Saturday lunch.  They have a lunch special where you get a cup of the soup of the day (which is usually egg drop soup on Saturdays - my favorite), a sizeable portion of the entree, rice (you can substitute brown rice for a little extra), a yummy little side salad on your plate with it, and then a free fortune cookie with your check.  They even give you a slice of gum, too to save your breath, which I thought was a nice touch.

So far, I've had the Basil Eggplant with Prawns & Chicken, which was fantastic - and the Cashew Chicken, which was also delicious and came with a ton of vegetables.

Every time that I've come (for Lunch & Dinner), I've walked out with an entire meal to warm up later - the portions are great, the execution and service are spot on, and it is a pleasant environment to dine in - there is a little bar and some sort of water fountain somewhere - you do not feel like you are at a take-out / delivery place when you are there.

In short, I highly recommend - steer clear of Hai Sun and any other menus delivered to your door are not "Yelp-vetted" and head to this place!
author: Kimberly K.

description: The absolute best meatless general tso's chicken! I keep going back for more and I always get extra broccoli.
author: Charlane B.

description: Love this place! They have great chinese food made with great ingredients.  Not like your normal greasy chinese take out places. I love their won ton soup, fried rice, potstickers, general's chicken to name a few.
author: Octavio T.

description:
Walked in here for dinner after a nearby burrito place only accepted cash. 

Burrito place: 0
Wonderland: 1

We were seated immediately. Service was quick and helpful. Water glasses never left empty.

DRINKS
+Beer comes in glass steins.
-The Blue Moon tasted... off.

EATS
+Crab rangoons (deep-fried wontons with a cream cheese and crab filling) are amazingly tasty.
+House spicy chow fun (wide flat rice noodles vs. chow mein's thin egg noodles) comes with pork, chicken, AND shrimp; not just one.
+The Mongolian beef is delicious.

Paid with a CREDIT CARD, thankyouverymuch, and left happily satiated.
author: Adena B.

description:
At first, I was sad that the Indian place with the white linen tablecloths had closed down before I had gotten a chance to try it, but the ridiculous red-and-green paint job won me over.  Two years later (really?), the green might be totally gone, but the red is as bright as ever, thanks to constant repainting.  I'm sad about the major change they've made to the sign, but that's about the only criticism I have of this place that doesn't affect my rating.

The food is excellent.  They offer fifteen different kinds of meatless chicken, and unlike most Chinese restaurants that offer so many options, Wonderland actually manages to make the different versions taste very different.  Or maybe I've just tried the six that don't taste like one another.

I have liked everything I've tried from here except for the garlic pea sprouts.  This is mostly Ed U.'s fault, as he recommended them and even took a picture of them for his review.  But the garlic pea sprouts have two problems.  First, they're a major choking hazard.  I know I eat fast, but I'm not one of those people who doesn't chew or who is constantly spitting up water because it went down the wrong pipe.  No, I almost choked eating these things, and from that point on, I was extremely careful while eating them.  And guess what?  I almost choked two more times.  They taste OK, I guess, but they really do need to come with a yellow WARNING label.  Oh, and second, they're way too expensive.  Almost nine bones for what amounts to a garlicky opportunity for your girlfriend to practice the Heimlich maneuver on you just seems like a stretch.  Unless your girlfriend has one of those savior complexes.  And even if she does, does she really want to make out with you after you've just eaten and spit up garlic pea sprouts?  OK, maybe she's into that too, but your luck isn't my luck, so don't rub it in.

Delivery is very fast.  They have their own online-ordering system, and while that annoyed me at first, it works well, and I've never had a problem with anything.  Overall, this should be a five-star review, but it's a little pricy for the portion size.  Other than that, though, go to town on everything.  Except for the garlic pea sprouts.
author: John S.

description: Omg I am soo upset I ordered food online at 1030 for 1245 delivery. I get a conformation email stating my order will be here as ordered. It's 1223 I get a call stating Im out of the area to deliver. I paid online $59.14 to be told thay cant fullfill the order. Im  in the delivery area 94115 CPMC Medical center. I will never order from these people again .. I cant belive how they conduct there business. The web states im in the area or else I would not have ordered from them. Now its too late to order from anyewhere else since im a RN and have a schedule lunch.. I feel bad for the fellow nurses who also did not get there lunch.  :(    Dont waste your time.
author: Melinda B.

description:
I'm currently holding a place holder here... I've had Wonderland about three times and I can say this...

I'm glad they're in the neighborhood and their food is pretty good.

That said, I've had an issue with delivery, notified the business in two separate attempts, and neither have yielded any attempt on their part to actually rectify the situation.

The on-line ordering system allows you to schedule a delivery...in theory.  My order has shown up almost 30 minutes prior to the scheduled time.  Basically, considering that I'm serving the food thirty minutes later...my dinner is nowhere near as good as can be and basically a waste of $30.

So, lesson learned, I will no longer trust their delivery scheduling.  And, basically give them one more chance in general.  Bandy Ho's also delivers to my house as does Greg's.

***
added stars for being proactive.
author: Chris D.

description:
I'm so glad Wonderland has moved to the Lower Haight. 

My favorite is the war wonton soup, but there are so many amazing items to choose from. 

It's clean and nice and in just about the best location you could ask for.
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
"Great addition to the neighborhood"

Amazing Chinese food. Had to order the Mapo Tofu again on my 2nd visit. Such deliciously powerful flavor. I don't normally like tofu but this was amazing.

So fresh! Also try the walnut prawns & eggplant with spicy garlic sauce. Both times my group tried out some of their Meatless Chicken dishes too, which honestly I couldn't discern from real chicken.

Great ambiance. Very accomodating even for our reservation of 11 people last night.
author: Anna R.

description:
Been here a few times for lunch, haven't been wowed yet.  The Mapo Dofu was ok one time, too salty to eat another.  The soup that comes with the lunches was a little bland.  They do have a sizeable vegetarian menu, which is a plus.

They are still pretty new and I live in the area so I will give them another shot and maybe upgrade my review.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Great and restaurant great service. Everything that we ordered was delicious, specially the chicken curry.

I will come back
author: Ignacio A.

description:
Horrible, horrible service. I should NOT have to flag a waiter down everytime I need something -- to order, to get bowls, to get the check, to pay the check. Note to the owner, you need to pay attention to the customers... It wasn't even busy at all. Maybe the tables near the window facing Haight might be blocked by that room divider, but still, I shouldn't have to wait and try to flag down a waiter.

The food here is good. Nice, traditional Chinese dishes. I liked the vegetable hong kong style noodles but could have came with more vegetables and adding tofu should be an option. The meatless chicken General Tso was too doughy for my liking.

When we asked for to-go boxes, they dumped everything into one container (vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes), and it was clear that everyone ordered their own dish. When we asked them about it, we got dumb stares.

I'd only get take-out from here, don't waste your time sitting down. You won't get service.

#vegetarian review
author: Eric H.

description: First time in this restaurant and overall it was a good experience.  We got to the restaurant before evening rush hour and surprisingly the server where not very attentive. During dinner I had to flag them down to get water, sauce, etc. Not a deal breaker and our dinner was OK... had the rice noodles which were lacking taste but the rest of our meal work good. We would give them another try.
author: Frank C.

description:
Great Chinese, quick and good value. I love that it's easy to pop in, pick up or get delivery. And you can even order online!

I am a huge fan of their Mu-Shu and they have great selection of vegetarian and lighter dishes if you're just not up for heavy Chinese meal.
author: Aki N.

description:
The only thing I'm left "wondering" about this restaurant is how they've managed to get such good reviews. I called to place an order for delivery, living well within the delivery radius detailed on their website. They stated the driver simply "didn't want to drive that far, sorry." Upon my protesting, they promptly hung up.

Their behavior and false advertising are unacceptable. 

I ended up ordering from Country Sky Chinese, which was delicious.
author: Michael B.

description: This is average Americanized Chinese food to me. Nothing to write home about. I got mapo tofu and kung pao chicken. It's weird getting mapo tofu with peas, carrots and mushrooms and the flavor is definitely off, unlike any I've had before. Kung pao was alright, comparable to Panda Express in flavor. The portion size for the price is great but this place isn't up my alley. Food needs more kick and I suppose I was looking for more authentic food. If you like Americanized flavors and ingredients, then you might love this place.
author: Cameron R.

description:
This place is pretty darn delicious! My wife and I went here last night and what a treat! We ordered the following:
Chicken Corn Soup - Good, nothing special (except that we were hungry, so it tasted super delicious!)
Mango Chicken - I'm really picky with my mango chicken because most often, I'm left disappointed.  I'm so happy to have found a restaurant that knows how to cook mango chicken.  This is a dish to try....if you like mango, like we do.
Eggplant with garlic sauce - I know it doesn't sound super delish, but it was.  I thought my wife's reaction to the dish was a bit over reacting, but when I tasted it, it was really good.  Great flavor and good portion.
Brown fried rice - We never had a brown fried rice and it was a great experience. Honestly, I can't even tell that it's brown rice because of it's robust flavor. 

The waiter/manager (I can't tell who he is because he was bossing the others around) was really funny and very personable.  He was friendly to all the customers and knows how to be a good host.  

This place is a must try if you're in the lower haight area.
author: N A.

description:
Sat afternoon - we ordered the following:

Avocodo rolls - extremely oily

Onion pancacke - extremely oily

Cumin Tofu - tofu was very dry and hard (think overcooked). Tasted like cardboard. Not a lot of flavor or spice

Eggplant with Shrimp and Chicken - Shrimp & Chicken were both very dry - totally overcooked. Eggplant was dripping oil

Spicy chowfun (veg) - not spicy at all

Overall extremely disappointed with this place. Will not go again.
author: Priya K.

description:
affordable, delicious and fast!!!

What more could you ask for. Their Hot and sour soup is just amazing and kinda spicy. 

everything i have had here is good. The eggplant, chicken, shrimps and all
author: farah b.

description:
Finally, a decent American Chinese food spot in SF. Now don't get me wrong, I appreciate how the Bay Area has some of the best authentic Chinese food in the U.S., but sometimes my midwestern stomach just craves the inauthentic, MSG-packed goodness of some General Tsao's or Kung Pao chicken. Wonderland delivers this perfectly, and everything I tasted was made well with quality ingredients. They even have a surprisingly large number of meatless "chicken" dishes that tasted suspiciously similar to their meat versions.

Having been open only a few weeks, Wonderland is still working through some small kinks (the soy sauce teapot thing has got to go - I managed to dribble soy sauce all over the table instead of my plate) but the service is quick, super friendly and they went out of their way to make sure we had a good experience. They don't have a liquor license yet, but according to the posting in the window it's in the works.
author: Mark A.

description:
"Fake" Chinese in Lower Haight. I have to admit, I have a soft spot for pseudo-sino-sustenance and Wonderland did not disappoint. It's a pretty new spot so it's spacious and clean and the service was affable as opposed to indifferent. What this place lacks in authenticity it makes up in genteel American charm.

Three friends and I shared General Tsao meatless "chicken," stringbean with fried tofu, cumin lamb, shredded pork and fried rice. The portion sizes are generous and there was plenty leftover the next day. I liked everything. It was that sweet 'sodium landslide' you need every now and then.

It's a shame you can't get booze here though. An alcohol licence will definitely help their rating in my books. 

Obligatory Title Pun: You want love, we'll make it/Swim in a deep sea, of BOK CHOI.

Menu Readability: It could use two fewer pages.

Need to mention: The food really does taste better the next day.

What this place teaches me about myself: I don't know anything about John Mayer, and I'd like to keep it that way.
author: Vivek S.

description:
I have just ordered at least 3 night's worth of food as I have been a Hermit all weekend, and never actually left the house to go food shopping! I have been to Wonderland for lunch, and always enjoyed it, fresh, no weir, grisly bits (which happens A LOT at other Chinese Restaurants) . 

My absolute favorite? Mongolian Beef- lots of tender meat,  not too spicy and yummy flavor. I ordered online tonight and the food was delivered less than an hour later. 

 Also, I have tried to order from other Restaurants in the Lower Haight, and they all refused delivery to my area, which is really close (Ashbury Heights).

 Lemon Chicken, BBq Pork, Mo Sui Chicken, BBq Pork Chow Mein, and of course, Mongolian Beef. This will keep me happy for at least three nights! 

Delicious, efficient, fresh, hot, and reasonably priced, since the death of my favorite Chinese (Yet Wah), Wonderland has come along to replace it and satisfy my cravings! It actually makes me mad to read the bad reviews! It hasn't even been open A YEAR people! Give it a chance. 

Thanks Wayne for coming up to Upper Terrace to deliver my cravings! I'm a big fan and so happy there is Chinese now offered in The Haight.

CT
author: polly t.

description:
I've been getting take out here since it opened and I cannot tell you how impressed I am with it - I recommend it to all of my friends in the neighborhood and would certainly recommend to any Yelpers looking for Asian or Chinese take out-style food.

I've tried a bunch of the chicken dishes, noodles and rices as well as the beef with broccoli and they've all been terrific but my go-to order with my roommate (which has now become a weekly staple) is the following: string beans with chicken and spicy szechuan chicken. My absolute favorites! Wish I wasn't so stuck on them because I'm dying to try others (garlic prawns, lemon chicken, etc.) but they are just so damn good.

While it's probably not the most authentic Chinese, there are plenty of options and I don't feel grossed out after eating it (though I stay away from the fried/breaded options like orange chicken). It's perfect if you're trying to be health-ish - lots of veggies and even simple, steamed entrees too!

The ordering process online is incredibly easy - plus they allow you to schedule an order which is great for when I'm at the office and want to time my take out for when I get home. No 45-60 minute wait! Plus, the driver/delivery man is usually the same super friendly guy who is always punctual.

I haven't been in to dine, but can only imagine it's just as nice. This is not only a welcomed addition to the local Lower Haight scene, but one of the best.

I'm wondering if they have come up with a customer loyalty program or any coupons, hmm... Props to Wonderland!
author: christine c.

description: This is the best Chinese Food in SF. The food is so good you can even over look the awkward service and timing of food ( you might wait 5-10 minutes between entrees being served - for Chinese cuisine this is unusual unless you order something like Peking Duck). Completely recommend.
author: Ian M.

description:
I ate at Wonderland tonight, They just opened in Lower Haight and the place was busy, I think other people like myself are happy to find a place with good Chinese food in the Lower Haight. The food was great, fresh and authentic. One of my friends that went with me is Vegetarian, and she was very happy with all the Vegetarian choices they had, I think they might have the biggest selection of Meatless Chicken dishes I have seen in the bay! The Meatless General Tsao Chicken was amazing, even a meat eater like myself couldn't tell the difference between that and one with real chicken, always a good sign when you can even fool the meat eaters! We also has Lamb with Scallion, Pork Fried Rice and Scallion Pancakes, all delicious. The service was great and friendly, the place looks really nice and to me one of the most important things is the place looked very clean. I was excited that they do delivery also, but since it is in my neighborhood, It was an enjoyable sit-down restaurant too! If you eat in, def make sure to try there loose leaf tea's, they were yummy.
Wonderland is a welcomed new comer in the Lower Haight, I will def be back!
author: dub g.

description: This place is tasty. A super solid choice for chinese food. It was fresh and they used good ingredients. My new go to spots when I am in the area.
author: Goodguy M.

description:
WOW ! 

This place came out of nowhere ! I live in the lower haight and I have been waiting for a good Chinese spot forever and it's finally here ! I'm giving it 5 stars because it's as good as it gets in this area.

Everything is good and so is the service. The Wor Won Ton soup is to die for and the Orange sesame chicken is really good. Take your pick off the menu and you wont be disappointed.
author: Mario W.

description:
I was thrilled when Chinese food finally made it to the LH.  Then I found out it was relatively cheap. And then I tried it.   :)
I have not had anything from here yet that I did not enjoy but the 5 stars I am giving this place are mostly due to the amazing Mongolian Beef.  I am hooked on the stuff and it is perfectly spiced.   
Super friendly staff and speedy delivery.  While i am not a vegetarian, I do appreciate the large set of options they present, which makes dining out with my friends much simpler.
author: Dwayne M.

description:
I tried out Wonderland this weekend, only a few days past their grand opening. I was super excited to have a Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood -- especially one with myriad vegetarian options! My boyfriend ordered the General Tsao's chicken and I ordered the General Tsao's meatless chicken. We both really enjoyed the food and the boyfriend thought the meatless dish might even have been superior! Go figure! I'll be psyched once they begin delivery, since 2 blocks may be too far to travel on lazy lazy days. Looking forward to returning!

My one gripe, if you could even call it that, was that our bill was presented to our table immediately after the dishes were cleared. Granted, I'd been on the fence about ordering coffee or dessert, but was a bit put off by not having been asked first. Small deal, nothing major.

The place was packed, though. Glad to see such a welcome reception to this brand-new joint!
author: Erica H.

description:
Just ordered some amazing food for delivery!! Delivery guy was super friendly, attentive and fast! I ordered food not to long ago and it arrived within 20 minutes. 
They have the most amazing:

Wonton Soup
Fried Rice
Fried Rolls
Chicken Broccoli

Sooooo glad there is a great Chinese Food place near by. 

Want fast, hot, delicious chinese food? Order from here!!!
author: Giovanni L.

description: Outstanding.  Simply put the best American-Chinese I've had in SF, and while I'm no Chili Bill, I've had more than my share over the years.  It's good enough that I'm happy to pay Postmates to deliver it to me in the Sunset when I'm surrounded by Chinese places already.  Every dish I've had here was executed perfectly, and the quality of the meats and vegetables really stand out as being fresh and well chosen.  This is one of those businesses where the quality of their food really shows that they care about going above and beyond for their customers.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Very happy to have a Chinese restaurant in the Lower Haight. Our baseline in the 'hood is mediocre (this is my opinion and shared by many LH friends), and the food was definitely above the baseline. I've enjoyed Big Lantern and Red Jade for years, but this is certainly a new "go to" that's much closer.

The restaurant was very busy at 8 on Thursday, lots of servers rushing about. We had great service, and I think we might have had one of the guys directing the action since he seemed to be barking directions to others. It did feel slightly intense, but in a very genuine "no, really, we want you to have the best service" way. He even gave me a quick pat on the arm telling me to take my time paying the bill. Like some others have mentioned, I wanted the guy to be more at ease as the whole experience was still good regardless of his haste. The food was good, the service friendly, and rather fair pricing for it all.

I don't even care about the bar. I was happy to see lots of kids and lots of families who seemed to be from the area. I hope the locals support this restaurant and that it becomes a staple of the Lower Haight.
author: Ben C.

description:
Great Chinese takeout/delivery. Food is always fresh, selection is excellent and they're always friendly. (And healthy options exist.)

But, if you're looking for something unhealthy, order the salt and pepper fake chicken. Five words: little balls of fried crack. Impossible to stop eating, and I'm not a vegetarian.

I agree that the hot and sour soup could use a bit of jazzing up, but its not really an issue, more a matter of taste. I still happily order it and just add a bit of rice vinegar and a few drops of chili oil. Super satisfying. 

Hope they stay open forever. There's a lack of this kind of reliable Chinese take out in the city (especially when compared to NYC options).

Edit: also they use Amay's fortune cookies, which are quite good.
author: anon m.

description:
(Review is for delivery only.)

I've ordered from Wonderland multiple times, and I have to say the food is OK. Nothing truly exceptional, but solid. The sesame chicken is crisp and perhaps a bit too chewy. The pot stickers are too doughy and often don't come with the dipping sauce I normally get from other places. The beef with asparagus is a bit salty, but definitely to my liking.

What really makes me gripe about Wonderland is their delivery. I live a mile from Wonderland and always order online through their online ordering tool (which is nice). However, I've often had to wait... and wait... and wait to get my food. Often the wait approaches two hours, and I have to call multiple times to check on order status.

I'd probably order from them again, but considering other good options with faster delivery, I probably won't.
author: Aaron L.

description: I was across the street at Tornado with friends having a few IPA's. They decided to grab some sausage sandwiches while I noticed this good looking Chinese restaurant across the street. I decided to order the cumin lamb and it was delicious. Lots of tender and well spiced lamb and assorted other veggies made this dish work for me. I thought the food was good and the atmosphere inside was very nice also.
author: Ray G.

description: This is my 2nd time here and still not disappointed! Prices are fair and the food was great! Me and my boyfriend shared the hot and spicy fried rice, sweet n sour chicken and pork fried dumplings. Yum! About a year before while on vacation with my mom we had the avocado spring rolls and basil chicken....double yum!!!
author: wendy q.

description: I work just a few blocks away from wonderland on Hayes which is a very clean upscaled area now.. But taking a trip to wonderland ( like 3 blocks away) it was like driving to a whole other city. It was filthy the streets smelled like marijuana... Walked in wonderland they greeted us right away. I was taking out so I ordered some food. And they told me it was a 15 minute wait, so decided to walk across the street to cvs.. The smallest cvs I've ever been to. Anyways just browsed through the isles until 15 minutes passed by. Got our food. Food was good nothing special.
author: Alayna's Momma S.

description:
Stuck in town for Xmas, so ordered some Chinese delivery. Bah humbug!
Food was "perfectly acceptable." Veggie eggrolls were good, crispy, not excessively greasy. Hot and sour soup had alot (aka "too much") ginger, which gave it a slightly medicinal taste. I did love that they offer soup in two sizes, unlike most Chinese restaurants, which seem to think everyone is feeding a family of six. My entree, Szcheuan (sp?) chicken was very fresh, with lots of veggies, but quite bland (unusual for the style). I was expecting more of a red, tangy, spicy sauce, but Chinese menus are like a box of chocolates, from one resto to another "you never know what you're gonna get." Prices were average. Overall, better than what you'd get at a Panda Express, or one of those storefront buffet style places in the Richmond, but nothing to write home about.
author: Jojo S.

description: It is sad how bad the delivery is. I've ordered twice in a week. The first time on Sunday after Bay to Breakers at 6:30pm, my order showed up late and when I called they said they were 10mins away and in total, it took 2 hours before our food got here. Second time, I ordered online, though it showed up on time, every single item ordered was cold!!! Never coming back again ... go to the Thai restaurant half a block down instead!
author: Chris P.

description: Delivery only:  I think this restaurant committed a crime by not including plum sauce with my mu shu pork. I've tried siracha and soy but there's a reason this sauce has probably been paired with this dish for centuries...nothing else works!
author: Jacquelyn H.

description:
What a great Restaurant , but I am going to say it is even better for Vegetarians.  There are so many choices and even desert that is vegetarian.  Great location , friendly service and fortune Cookies.

We had the   General Tsao "Meatless Chicken" fantastic, Onion Pancakes, fantastic  garlic pea shoots. Steamed brown rice.  I am glad we have a good Vegetarian Restaurant choice in the Lower Haight.
author: Andres N.

description: Service and presentation were good, prawns were tasty (if you don't mind heavy battery) - good place for a quick lunch while on the road... seems like a good place to bring the kids.  #chinesefood #yummy
author: James W.

description:
I so want this place to succeed. The staff is really nice, it looks super clean, location, etc. (These things keep bringing me back.)

But the food is hit or miss.  I get a lot of chicken cooked so long it's like beef jerky. 
Which boggles my mind since how can you overlook deep fried things with out some outer burn?! Beef as well.  Not many vegetables or sauce sometimes.

I want sweet & sour chicken that is the highest quality cuts and not cooked so long you cannot even chew it.  If they get that right a lot of the neighborhood would order more often. 

But the prices are great.
I'd also like half orders of the fried rices'
author: Nicole V.

description:
This place is really good. Finally found a great tasting Chinese place in the city and they deliver! They use high quality ingredients, dont feel sick after eating it.

Ordered:
Walnut Shrimp - very good, creamy
Orange Chicken - damn good & very orangy
Broc Beef - decent beef, quality broc, albeit a bit undercooked (but i liked it that way)
Chow Mein - average, flavorless, but you can add meat for free, yay! although 'bbq pork' had zero bbq flavor to it. 
Mushu Pork - would pass on this next time.

Came with fortune cookies. :)
author: Michael M.

description:
I had such high hopes for this place.


I am extremely curious why people will eat or cook with cottonseed oil when cotton IS NOT A FOOD! Also it is full of pesticides ugh. The waiter spoiled my appetite with that information and now all Asian restaurants are suspect to me. I may never order fried anything from them again. Seriously.

I ended up ordering the egg drop soup which was horrible but I was starving and I'd already liked the inside decor and menu options until I found out that nothing fried on it was available to me :(

I ordered the large of the soup thinking it was a safe option until I tasted it. $8 plus tip wasted and pissed away.

Pretty place but beware of the food quality. All that glitters is definitely not gold
author: L W.

description:
I ordered to go. But I found the ownership and staff to be warm and organized during my time waiting for my food (not long).

The food was solid. The staple dishes I ordered were good, clean dishes done well. Prices were reasonable and the restaurant itself was pleasant.

I will definitely be returning.
author: Jordan W.

description:
Question: what was the place before all about, does anyone know?
Anyways I'm so glad like so many of my LH mates that we have a decent Chinese food place.  Really enjoyed the cumin lamb, my GF had the fish and said it was too salty...
The portions are huge so I had leftovers for a couple of days.  I still need to try the mushu pork and wonton soup next.  I agree with a previous post: they need to relax with the service and not try sooooo hard, it would make everyone feel more comfortable.  I like the rasta colors outside, it's a bit confusing and funny.  Oh yeah: good prices, please keep it that way and I'll be back.
author: Monkey B.

description:
I decided to try this place out and I'm glad we have decent Chinese food in the neighborhood. I only ordered take-out and got the Singapore style noodles. It cost around $10 including tip, and I was really pleased with how fresh the ingredients and spices were. I just sat at the bar to wait, and was instantly brought water. The lady who took my order was very nice, and the food was done in no time. 

Definitely coming here again, and I can't wait to try more things on the menu! Thanks for being awesome, Wonderland!
author: Leigh H.

description: Awful food. Some dishes were overtly spicy and some were full of soya sauce. I recommend staying hungry than eating here !!
author: Karan S.

description:
Pretty standard American Chinese menu with added dishes for vegetarians.  The food's good, but nothing to get excited about in San Francisco considering what you can get in the avenues. Still, this was sorely needed in the Lower Haight, so I'm glad they're in the 'hood. For delivery, I'd go elsewhere.

As of 14 Sep 2012, Yelp reviewers have this pegged as a $ restaurant.  This is not correct. The majority of the individual dishes are in that range, but when you factor in rice, drink, tax, and tip, it's the lower end of $$. Also, they take AmEx in the restaurant, but you can't order online with AmEx even though it's a visible option by their ordering service. Weird.
author: Jim S.

description:
My new favorite, inexpensive Chinese restaurant in San Francisco.  This place costs the same as some of their competitors (like Red Jade just a few blocks away) but the food seems much more fresh and there are more menu options.  Of note is that they have several vegetarian options which are very good, and I'm not usually one to enjoy dishes that use "fake meat."  

My favorite dish here is probably the cumin lamb.

My only real complaint about this place is the water:  obviously straight from the tap with the strong chemical taste mixed with the lemon they use to try to make it more palatable.  Yuck.  It would be nice if they had a wider variety of alternate beverages since of just one diet soda and several sugary sodas.  I usually just end up not drinking anything when I eat here.
author: Jeff S.

description: This place is great, the service is nice and the food really tasty. The orange chicken its my favourite, i order there almost every week. Highly recomended!!
author: Wilmarí T.

description: Found this restaurant on yelp and decided to give it a try. Came here with a couple of friends and everyone loved everything they ordered. Me and my boyfriend ordered the Kung pao tofu, Mongolian beef, and spicy garlic eggplant which were all delicious! Our friends ordered the chicken chow mien, Kung pao chicken, and curry chicken which they enjoyed all three dishes as well! Honestly, some of the best Chinese food I've had in a while and the service was fast and friendly! I will defiantly return next time I visit the city!
author: Brittany Y.

description: The meat that I've had here usually has a few bad pieces in the dish and it has nearly always been cold/under-cooked in a few spots. This is always a huge turn-off to me for a meal - as it usually makes me think the meat comes from a frozen bag.  I have stopped going because this has happened all to frequently for me.
author: Corbin F.

description: This place is really good! I was a bit skeptical about coming in but I'm glad I did. They took a long time to take our order but the waiters sense of humor and kind attentiveness made everything good. The food came out fast and tasted fresh to me. I would definitely recommend this place if anyone is in the area (:
author: Anaid C.

description: How many times have we dined there!? Quick and so yummy! Price is great and big portion. One entree would last me three  meals and all the people who work there is really friendly and move quickly. I never have to wait more than 10 minutes to dine or pick up. I love this place!  the atmosphere is classy but casual. You don't have to dress up to dine there, but they offer classy mood to dine quietly.
author: Sp L.

description:
Both the meat and meatless options are absolutely delicious. So happy to have a great Chinese spot in the neighborhood. The staff is super friendly and helpful as well.

Had to update, the food is delicious, but the health code is always so bad I can't even eat here anymore. Clean the place up!
author: Adam G.

description:
If you like Americanized Chinese food - this is your place.

If you like authentic Chinese food - you'll be disappointed.
author: Ben Y.

description:
I used to love this restaurant but I had a horrible experience yesterday.

First when they sat me down, the table was dirty. The place mat was dirty and the tablecloth was stained with a fresh food stain. I asked if I could get a different clean table and they gave me attitude.

The thing that really bothered me was getting REAL chicken when I ordered MEATLESS chicken. I could tell from the start it wasn't right, luckily I didn't eat it and asked them if this was the meatless chicken. 

Overall, I wish this place wouldn't have disappointed me this one time, maybe I'll give them a second chance? I doubt it.
author: Karen B.

description:
Wow that was the WORST meal I've had in a long time. Here's what we ordered:

Lemon fish
General tsao chicken
Onion pancake
Garlic pea sprouts
Combination chow fun

The last two were at least edible but literally everything else was awful. I wish I could feed to my dog so it doesn't go to complete waste, but I'm pretty sure even she will get sick :(

Their online delivery system is pretty user-friendly, but I'm really disappointed that I wasted so much money on such mediocre food...bummer
author: Malia P.

description: Their meatless chicken is SO good. I always order take out, often after a bike ride, and usually have my bike with me when I go to pick my food up. They're so accommodating, allowing me to bring my road bike in instead of locking it outside where it'd probably get stolen. I've gotten food to go there often, and they've never once messed up my order.
author: Karen R.

description:
I ate here 3 times within 6 days... so great to have a decent chinese place in the neighborhood.

the waiters were very attentive and nice, and the food was just great. 
So excited to try more!

this is not a place you should expect to get authentic chinese food - it's pretty americanized (not that i know the traditional chinese food), but this is a great place to have a casual meal.

do try their red oil wanton and cumin lamb. they are the bomb.
author: Sung C.

description:
Love the location!  Nice decor... um... the service was fine.  And then... well... not much else.

After rave reviews from my roommate and her boyfriend, I was waiting on pins and needles for an opportunity to sample their vittles.

Much to my dismay, they served me the worst hot and sour soup I've slurped to date.  I mean ugh!  It wasn't hot (other than the temperature) and it certainly wasn't sour.  What gives, Wonderland?

We also ordered some mediocre noodle dishes, but when everything was already priced on the upper end, I just don't see myself going back.

Thanks but no thanks.  I'll stick to Red Jade; they may have a less desirable location (for me), but they consistently serve up delicious delivery and dine-in.
author: Jamie B.

description: Based on their style of cooking, just ate one of the best tasting dishes I've had. Yes, I eat at House of Nanking, Hong Kong Flower, Brandy Ho's, etc., however the Eggplant with Basil, Prawns, Scallops in Garlic Sauce was delicious!  Best thing about it was I could taste the individual flavors through the delicious garlic sauce.  Plenty of prawns & scallop pieces. Worth the $15.27 for take-out. Be back soon.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Great to finally have some Chinese in the Lower Haight!!

I haven't tried it all, but on your next order, do yourself a favor and order the incredible house fried rice. Absolutely mind blowing great. Tons of chunks of goodness, that grilled subtle fried rice flavor, and extremely fresh tasting. Hands down the best fried rice I've had.
author: Scottie L.

description:
I'm impressed. The food was very fresh and hot when it arrived and the delivery took less time than advertised. Their pork mushu is excellent, and I also really enjoyed the Orange chicken. I think the Orange chicken here reminds me of Panda Express, only of clearly higher quality because it tastes like actual Orange citrus instead of the Orange-like flavoring at Panda. Won ton soup is also scrumptious. The hot and sour soup is not so good which disappointed because that is usually my favorite thing to get at a Chinese restaurant. It is a different take on the broth than I'm used to and I don't care for it. My favorite hot and sour soup is from Chef Chu's down in Los Altos and I just did not like the Wonderland broth as much.

Overall I loved my experience and will definitely order from them again. Would give 5 stars if the hot and sour was better.
author: Ean J.

description: Sometimes the food here is very very good and sometimes it's bland. Not actively bad, just unappetizingl/dry. It seems the meat options are always tasty, while the vegetarian options routinely leave something to be desired.
author: Amy S.

description: First, we like that this place was open at 3pm, as many places are closed from 2:30-5pm. We had regular dish cashew and asparagus, both dishes with meatless chicken. We took the lunch special which came with spicy soup and rice came with our main dish! The veggies were fresh and the meatless chicken was very flavourful! They were generous with their portions. The waitress was very kind and helpful. The food was great, and the total cost of two meals was only $21.70. The place is pretty clean and so were the washrooms. I would go back here anytime!
author: Emma B.

description:
Seems like a family-run place, so I wish them luck, but sadly I thought the food was bland and Americanized. 

Came here for a late lunch on a Sunday, and a few other tables were occupied in the spacious and nicely decorated place. The high ceilings are awesome.

Ordered the sizzling rice soup and the mapo dofu, hoping it'd come close to the version Mission Chinese Food serves (no dice). 

The sizzling rice part of the soup was flavorful, but the soup itself was not. It was impossible to know what the soup was suppose to taste like (seafood? chicken? vegetable?) because it was so bland. There was a good amount of shrimp, chicken, and veggies in it though. Not to brag, but I'm kind of a sizzling rice soup connoisseur, having made my Chinese mother order it EVERY SINGLE TIME we dined at a Chinese restaurant from when I was 8 to 16 years old. 

The mapo dofu was heavy on the Sichuan peppercorns, which is an odd complaint for me since I usually think it doesn't have enough or any at all. But the numbing spice was overpowering, and none of the other flavors in the dish stood up to it.

My dining companion ordered the sweet and sour chicken, and it came out a startling and unnatural orange color. And it was worse than Panda Express.
author: Carolyn F.

description: This is my go to Chinese delivery place.  It's delicious and reliable.  The basil tofu and chow mein are my favorites.  Online ordering is really convenient.
author: NaomI T.

description:
Great random choice while walking around - Really cheap lunch specials and some of the best Chinese food I've had in a very long time!

The atmosphere was fine - very sunny (corner lot) and not too loud. There were a few other groups there for lunch when we were there. 

The food was really good - the lunch specials came with hot and sour soup, which was great. I would've liked some little crispies with it (I have no idea what the actual name is, so I made up my own - hopefully you know what I mean?) I got the mongolian beef and steamed rice, which came in a very generous portion size and had great flavor. It also seemed like good quality beef. My boyfriend got his usual General Tso's chicken and liked it as well.
author: Jess G.

description: Really good fresh spring rolls and pot stickers. We ordered from the lunch menu so the entries came with soup rice and a salad. I had the green beans and chicken and my wife the Mongolian beef. Both were very good. We will go back again.
author: Nancy B.

description: We love Wonderland! Out of all the Chinese take-out places we've tried in the last five years, this is the best. It was easy/no hassles to order, and the food was fresh and delicious. We'll be back!
author: Jade F.

description:
Okay I am so Taiwanese. Like beyond, 150% Taiwanese. I love Chinese food, but I live in the Lower Haight, pretty much only eat authentic Chinese food when I go home twice a month, and have an American boyfriend. 

The perfect compromise? Wonderland! 

They have an extensive list of foods that my boyfriend can love (who leans a bit more towards Americanized Chinese food) and I can choose from. I enjoy their spicy chow fun because it has that special mouth-numbing herb yet is not super herb-flavorful up to a point where my boyfriend can't enjoy. I particularly enjoy the simple cucumber salad, because it reminds of childhood, but I also think they can add a bit of vinegar to give it that pickled-spicy-sour taste. 

I also enjoyed the General Tsao's chicken, even though it's pretty much a blasphemy to breathe the name of that dish to my parents. The bf loved it, and to be honest, every dish is ... pretty healthy, as I don't feel incredibly uncomfortable after. Also, the MSG gods aren't calling my name after this meal as well. 

So it's a great addition to the neighborhood, and a great option if you want something somewhat light and healthy depending on what you order.  Only thing I would like to see are some more noodle dishes or maybe even noodle soup!
author: Christina L.

description: Very nice atmosphere, very good food.  Wasn't sure waiter understood my wife's gluten-free / dairy free needs but did well.
author: Brett S.

description:
I seriously just joined Yelp to write this review! 

We've been ordering from here for a while now, and it's always really good. And then, we ordered the other night...it was the best Chinese food I've ever had. I'm not sure what they did differently, but wish I had ordered double it went so fast. My biggest fear is that they stop delivering to my address, as I am already a little outside their delivery window.

We ordered the General Tso Chicken, Veggie Chow Mein, and Hot and Sour Soup. All were incredible. I just finished the left overs and am debating ordering again. Yum!
author: Amanda H.

description: Really good egg rolls, spicy chow fun, good kung pao chicken. Quick take-out pick up.
author: Jillian N.

description: I visited this place after passing it frequently on my way to work and finally reading the reviews on yelp I decided to try it out. The colorful outside deterred me fron taking this place seriously to tell you the truth but I was wrong and pleasantly surprised when I went inside. Its a small dining area but keeps pretty busy during the lunch period that I visited. I was surprised to find myself scarfing down their miso soup when I never really eat the stuff. (Its gelatonous consistancy grosses me out.)Theirs was delicious. I was even more surprised when they brought my sesame chicken with rice and salad. The presentation was above what I expected and the salad was visibly fresh. I cant say I thouroghly enjoyed my sesame chicken. I asked questions and the waiter did inform me it was somewhat sour and sweet. I didnt expect the burn in my nose from this sauce, it was very strong. The flavor was good though but I do have to say the chicken was a little over cooked. The salad was delicious. I may try this place one more time because at least the service was good and they didnt think twice to seat me when I walked in by myself with a double stroller and two babies under 1 years old. My charges are well behaved but any other place probably would have muttered an obsenity under their breath and given me an incredulous look.
author: Maria M.

description:
The tension is so thick in this place, you could cut it with a knife! You can tell they are trying really hard to please you, I mean they are trying WAY too hard. They need to just relax! When the waitress took our order she asked me what I wanted to drink and I said, "just tea" and she asked me "what kind?" and I said "oolong" and she said they didn't have it (???) and so I said I'd take any black tea, and she mentioned one I'd never heard of, and asked if I wanted chrysanthemum in it and I said "sure, why not." 

So then she takes off, completely ignoring my husband who was waiting to give her his order. She was gone for about 5 minutes. She was rushing around and talking with the other servers about my tea. I guess they wanted my teapot to be PERFECT because it took a long time and she forgot to come back. So I'm looking in her direction with a confused look on my face and she looks at me nervously until she realizes her mistake and comes rushing back to confirm my order and almost walks off again but asks my husband if he wants to order anything and he says, "uh, YEAH."

The few things Wonderland has going for it are that it's spotlessly clean and the servers are polite. The food is hit or miss. I ordered chicken fried brown rice and it was very salty. My husband ordered a faux chicken dish and it was delicious. The veggies were really fresh and the sauce was just right. I'm thankful they are trying to offer healthy and vegetarian options. I'm not going to get into the debate on whether this is real Chinese food or not because I like both.

They should stop sweating the small stuff. Americans who like Chinese food don't have terribly high standards for simple things like tea! I want the typical Chinese food staples I'm used to: free hot tea, common Chinese/American dishes, chopsticks (you have to ask for them), hot sauce at my table, and fortune cookies that do not come in fancy wrappers. Seems like they are paying too much attention to details that don't matter (super fancy silverware and linens.) Just make good food, leave a large bottle of Sriracha close by, keep the place reasonably clean and make me feel comfortable.
author: L. L.

description:
You can definitely find better Chinese food in San Francisco than this place. 

In addition to the wide selection of cleaner, higher quality Chinese spots, the customer service was aggressively insulting.

After ordering delivery online, I waited one hour and 20 minutes before calling to ask if the order even successfully went through. The man who replied (Winnie or Alex) smugly replied, "Relax. It's coming." and hung up on me.

Wonderland, your abysmal customer service has forced me to order medicore Chinese food elsewhere.
author: Christine M.

description: Its been ok in a pinch for takeout, but on the greasy side.  If you can eat wheat/gluten and sugary things, the veg chicken is great. My partner really likes it
author: tara s.

description: Amazing food, fast service.  I wish the tables were just a little bigger it got a bit crowded on such a small table but when you eat you forget all about it. Orange beef is all I need in life.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Good Chinese food, I usually order online from there. The service is good and fast.
author: Igor P.

description: Based on yelp reviews and location , I decided to give Wonderland a chance for delivery and I am so glad I did. We ordered chicken wings and pot stickers as appetizers (both delicious). For entree, we ordered Mongolian beef(be careful, its spicy!), salt and pepper prawns,  and the spicy fried rice special. The food arrived within 40 minutes and was nice and fresh. Originally, there was a miss communication that led to me not receiving my steamed rice but they were able to quickly handle it and delivery rice within 10 minutes. This will definitely be my go to Chinese delivery spot!
author: Mak T.

description:
My company offers a catered lunch via Zesty on Fridays, and this week Zesty brought us Wonderland Restaurant.  One of the dishes, the beef with broccoli had as all perplexed, as no one had ever seen beef that looked like this.  It was quite pale and the texture was quite odd.  The taste of this dish while being foreign didn't vary much from the chicken with cashews.  

Even now I am still wondering what type of mystery meat i just ate.  Luckily the green beans were servicable, and was the only thing generally agreed upon as edible.

#mysterymeat
author: Mike S.

description: Chinese food - a Christmas Eve family tradition that I have been unable to continue for the past few years - has finally found a home!  Now that I've discovered Wonderland Restaurant, I will be having their excellent cuisine more often!  The staff member with whom I dealt, Wayne, was very pleasant and polite.  As I ordered take-out, I was seated at the bar and waited only ten minutes for my order to be completed.  I left one very happy customer!  Thank you Wonderland!
author: David C.

description: One of the better Chinese delivery spots in the city.  Good quality ingredients for the genre and solid preparation.  Some dishes are a bit greasy, but it goes with the territory...
author: Alex H.

description: I work five blocks away and eat here all the time. Never had a bad meal here. I'm a vegetarian and I love the chow mein, meatless chicken, veggie pot stickers. Also, the delivery guy is really nice.
author: Matthew C.

description: after ordering dinner delivery twice from Wonderland, this has become my go-to Chinese restaurant. The quality of the food is excellent for the price, the online ordering system is so simple (on their website) and their delivery is fast! They also have more vegetarian options than other Chinese places. If you live close by, you must check it out! I will definitely visit/order again.
author: Tanya S.

description:
We moved into the neighborhood recently and Wonderland is a great find. For starters, the delivery was super quick.
We got the singapore style rice noodles, kung pao meatless chicken and the eggplant dish. All three dishes were delicious and excellent. It's especially nice to see a well done Singapore rice noodles, many places tend to lean too heavy on the curry powder which ruins the dish. The noodles weren't too greasy either so WIN!

The star of the show was undoubtedly the kungpao meatless chicken. For a vegetarian like myself, who is constantly disappointed that most restaurants tend to equate vegetarian with health nut food without spices and flavor, this was a refreshing change. The kungpao meatless chicken had excellent texture, with no hint of rubberiness that paired very well with the top notch peanuts. 
The eggplant dish was also good but was a bit greasy but that I suppose is par for this genre.
author: Ramnath B.
