description: Best Chinese food I've had in a long time. The red oil wontons are awesomely unique and spicy. Huge portions to share.
author: Sarah B.

description:
This place is the best chinese food that delivers in the city that I have found in my 8 years of living here.  I have tried many other places and have been greatly disappointed.  I usually walk to my nearby favorite Eliza's for takeout when I am having a craving but someone told me about Wonderland and how they delivered so I gave it a try.  The first two times I ordered food from there it was quickly delivered to my door in an imressive 30 minutes and I was very impressed with the food.  So much so that I told one of my buddies about this place and he has had delivery from them over 6 times in a month.... 

This place lost a star from me last night because my experience was not as ideal.  The food quality was actually the best that I have had from them and would give between a 4 and 5 star rating  (I think we mastered our order).  However it took 1.5 hours to be delivered when we were told it would be around 45 minutes.   We called after an hour and was told it was on its way.  Since we live less than 2 miles away, after 20 minutes we called again when it hadnt arrived.  At this point we were starving and told them nevermind about our order, we were just going to heat up leftovers.  A few minutes later it arrived.  We were starving and it was delicious.  We called back and told them that our order had arrived and the customer service was polite and we were told that our wait time was not acceptable, which I appreciated.  

Next time we have a chinese craving I will try them again because I do really like the food, I just hope it wont take as long to get to be delivered to us or that we are told an accurate estimate when placing the order.  I will then add an additional star!
author: Jessica M.

description: we are already addicted to this place.  first visit on xmas eve with other Jewish friends and then again last night.  Szechuan fish is spicy well cooked fish w peapods and jalapeños.  their version of dry green beans is with garlic and salt and fried tofu.  basil eggplant w chicken and shrimp is also great and I don't even like eggplant (so much that I took it off my CSA box list!).  my son liked the BBQ spareribs and the Mongolian beef.  honestly everything met or exceeded expectations.  service is effective and friendly.  especially love the v frequent water glass refilling!
author: Xander S.

description: Since I've eaten here dozens of times the least I can do is write a review. Best general tso's ive ever had, hands down, which is why I keep coming back. The sauce is sticky and the chicken is fried to a perfect crisp. You can't beat their portion sizes and prices. Nothing bad to say about this place.
author: Michael B.

description: Great food. Clean place. Food came out very quickly! I would say they need bigger tables for bigger groups. Me and my family can here (4) and the table was no where near big enough for all of our food.
author: Nick H.

description: I heard really great things about this place, so was excited to try it for delivery.  Last night, I ordered the sesame chicken, singapore noodles, and brown rice.  I thought the deliver was quick and the deliveryman was very nice.  I also thought the brown rice was cooked well and so were the noodles.  However, the BBQ pork that came with the noodles was way over cooked and chewy, so I ended up tossing the pork and just ate the noodles.  I love sesame chicken, but the order I received was again overcooked and dry, some pieces were so badly over cooked that they had a texture similar to beef jerky.  I don't think I will try this place again, but it could be that they were just having an off night?
author: Kevin M.

description: My go-to Chinese delivery spot. In particular the Mongolian Beef and pork dumplings are awesome.  Plan for 45-60 mins for delivery if you are within their delivery zone!
author: Tyler L.

description: I just ordered the Roast Duck today during lunch, and it was spectacular. My lunch order came with a mound of white rice (brown rice is an option), a small side salad, and the house soup (egg drop soup today). The duck was seasoned pretty well (maybe a tad too salty) and the skin was crispy and soft at the same time. The rice, salad, and soup were all great. My meal came out to $10.25 including tax and tip, which is awesome. The service could have been a little faster, hence the four stars. I will be keeping this place in mind for the next time I come to the city!
author: Kha-ai N.

description: Eaten here several times and always am really impressed with the food. Always ready to come back here.
author: Jeff W.

description: Wonderland has a new sign -- the windstorm we had a few weeks ago blew away the old one. No worries, the food is still great. Great vegetarian menu, and lots of vegan options. I'm a fan of the Szechuan meat-less chicken. Although, the vegetables sometimes change, sometimes you get asparagus, sometimes you don't. Overall, great standby, and quick!
author: Pedro H.

description: Wonderland has knocked it out of the ball park for me 2 times now. It's a nice and cozy Chinese restaurant on Haight that delivers that Americanized Chinese food that I love. Standouts include orange chicken, garlic & chinese broccoli, barbeque pork, spare ribs, General's chicken and sesame beef.
author: Greg J.

description:
To satisfy a random Sunday night craving for Chinese tofu, my roommate and I drove down to lower Haight and saw the "Grand Opening" sign in front of Wonderland. Originally planning to grab some cheap pick-up and go home, we decided stay since the decor suggested a better-than-your-usual Chinese hole-in-the-wall restaurant. 

We ordered the avocado veggie roll, General Tsao tofu, and veggie chow mein. The veggie roll was the best I've had. Crispy, tasty, fresh ingredients. Great flavor and texture for the chow mein. And finally the tofu was crispy, soft on the inside, and fun to pour the separate sauce over to create a custom flavored Chinese dish of tenuous etymology.

The service was also great. Our waiter Sammy was helpful and humorous with suggestions and honest about the larger portion sizes so we didn't order too much. 

To conclude, best Chinese food we've had in our admittedly limited experience with mid-to-higher end Chinese food in San Francisco.
author: Jugal S.

description: Love love love this place.  We eat there once a week and always get the war wonton soup and the spicy house fried rice. The soup is amazing!  I must admit that I have not ordered a lot of other things.
author: Andrew G.

description: Very poor service and food was below average. I have had better food at the cheapest and sketchiest of Chinese takeout places. Even the fortune cookies were bad. That's when you know.
author: Maey P.

description: Love this place! I order delivery all the time and they are always very nice. No delivery charge for orders over $15 (well technically it's 10 cents but that's almost nothing). The orange chicken is OK but I wouldn't recommend fried stuff for a ToGo order. Stick to the non-fried disheds. My favorites are Mango Chicken and Veggie Chow Mein. Also good as leftovers.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
WARNING: HEAVEY USE OF MSG! 
I didn't even know what was happening at first. My food just tasted strange and then my tongue was tingling in the most peculiar way. At first I thought maybe it was just spicey, but I really couldn't tell what I was tasting and it was just such a strange sensation. I gave my food to a friend who thought it was fine at first but then started experiencing the same thing. He told me it was MSG. I looked it up and that is the exact symptom of MSG use. "MSG has been labeled an excitotoxin because it is thought to have the ability to overstimulate cells to death. Many people link headaches, flushing, poor attention and other symptoms, as well as diseases like fibromyalgia, to MSG intake." Consumption over time is a very serious health risk. Beware, this place loads it on.
author: Johna G.

description: Now that I have moved and no longer go to Wonderland I realize just how lucky I was to have it so close. I had to update my review to 5 stars because I can't find a better Chinese food restaurant anywhere.
author: Frank J.

description: We ordered takeout again and they were very punctual.  And the food quality did seem to get better.    It seems that they've worked out all the kinks since they opened.   So this will definitely be my go to Chinese food in the hood.
author: Stevan D.

description: I do not eat Gluten and I like to eat healthy food, which usually means Chinese food is not an option. I had a great meal at Wonderland that met all of my requirements. While they do not offer Gluten-free Soy Sauce, they were willing to exclude Soy Sauce from my selections. Additionally, the vegetables and meats they used in the meal were all high-quality and cooked to perfection. I will definitely come back again!
author: Josh M.

description: BEST American-Style Chinese restaurant in the area. I typically order the House Spicy Chow Fun, which is always chock full of a variety of meats, including prawns, and vegetables...tho I usually add asparagus. If I'm feeling healthy I'll order the Steamed Mixed Veg with Prawns with the Szechuan sauce! The service is always spot-on, too!
author: Rebecca C.

description: I've had Wonderland deliver several times, and they never fail to impress. Quality food every time. I've only had the vegan dishes but for Chinese, this is the way to go.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Came here christmas day by myself... Sad and lonely right???  Lol.  But it deserved a new review.  The servers were so friendly and helpful.  I had the cucumber salad, pork potstickers, general tao's tofu and brown rice.  Was so delicious!!!  Especially love the general tao's tofu... That sauce is delicious and served on the side to everything is still crispy.  Love this place!   :-))
author: Daniel A.

description: One minute. One spoon. One universe. Onederland.
author: Randy R.

description: Good for East Coast transplants. The sauce on the chicken and broccoli is not as congealed, and the wonton soup has way more than wontons floating in it, but this is the closest I've found to the Chinese food I ate growing up in Westchester New York. If you know what I'm talking about, go here.
author: Victoria P.

description: Love this place! Lunch specials are great and delicious - shrimp and eggplant / salmon with sparragus
author: Nia C.

description: The was good. My group and untried the mango chicken, sesame chicken, mango chicken, and broccoli and chicken. Prices are average for an entree. Nice service and nice people.
author: Sundiata C.

description: SO GOOD. We ordered the chicken fried rice, sesame beef and chicken and corn soup. All three items were some of the best I've had! The fried rice was perfect, exactly how I love it. The sesame beef was tender, not overly breaded, and the sauce wasn't too salty! The chicken and corn soup was great too! My only dislike was that the fried rice was a little oily.... but then again, it's Chinese food! I'm so glad they deliver to my apt for free!
author: Kristina B.

description: Warning: I just called and asked the restaurant if anything can be made gluten-free.  He said all of it.  I said no, there's always some items that cannot be altered.  He said we can take CORNSTARCH out of anything.  Beware Celiacs!
author: Charla W.

description: I'm in love with this place! Their lunch specials are out of this world! They have excellent vegetarian options!!! There food is always fresh and delicious and the service is very prompt. Great job Wonderland! Keep on rockin'! I love you (heart symbol)
author: Cha Cha Z.

description:
It's really a 2 1/2 stars.

The food is typical American Chinese food you'd find in any strip mall in small town America.  It's edible and and restaurant looks very clean.

One vegetarian dish came with shrimp and pork in there, and when we told the waitress, she promptly replaced and served with an apology.  So the service was good.

However, nothing I had would entice me to return.
author: daphne w.

description: Wonderland is awesome. Best Chinese delivery around me. All of the classic takeout dishes but you can tell its quality. Haven't been disappointed in anything I've ordered as of yet. If you are looking to find a review to help make you decide on this place, just stop and do it, you will not regret it. I've ordered here 10+ times and had to wait too long for food once, I'll take that.
author: Taylor M.

description:
ONLINE DELIVERY ORDER - 1hr 15 min

Ordered: 
General Chicken
Chicken Chow Mein
Brown Rice

The food is good but the somewhat long delivery time (quoted 45-60min, actual time was longer) made the food less than hot when it arrived. Not a big deal. My only complaint is that the Chow Mein was....slimy? I think the noodles were overcooked a little and it was a bit mushy. Would've really benefited from a crunch. The driver said they were super busy so perhaps my batch just got overlooked.

All in all, what I had was tasty. Even the brown rice was cooked perfectly. I really liked that they threw in a few pieces of broccoli to garnish. Tasty! You can definitely tell this place uses FRESH ingredients. 

The driver had a problem finding the place (he didn't read the notes I left) but he was quick to call me and everything was fine. 

I'd give it a 4.5, I really wouldn't order the Chow Mein again.
author: pretty w.

description: Just ordered delivery from Wonderland for the first time and I am so glad I did! This food was delicious and this place will definitely be our staple Chinese delivery place from now on. The delivery was easy and fast and all of the dishes I ordered were so tasty. A little salty, though. The chicken fried rice was awesome. If you want Chinese delivery in the area, order from here for sure
author: Taylor S.

description: Everything is good. Never been to the restaurant aways get our food delivered. This is the best Chinese food I've had in SF and I love Chinese food. Prices fantastic, Huge portions. The wings are a revelation.
author: Roger C.

description:
I think two stars is being pretty generous here.

We ordered online on a Sunday night and it took our food 2 hours to arrive. 3 items.

I called in after an hour to check that the order was even received, I was told it would be another half hour because of how busy they were that night (understandable). But alas, it took another hour.

As far as the food goes, it was pretty average. 

The fried rice seemed to be drenched in soy sauce...which is pretty unusual to me. The walnut prawns were a little too mayo-ey. The kung pao chicken was all right, but still not even close to being worth a two hour wait.

Don't think we'll be ordering from here again after such a disappointing first experience. 

Sorry :-/
author: Ben W.

description: Great service, delicious Hong Kong crispy noodles and a surprise green tea ice cream on Valentine's day! Great night!
author: Lettie M.

description: It's my weekly go-to place for my Chinese food fix!  Great food, quality ingredients, and friendly service.
author: Jake Z.

description: Delicious food (Singapore Style Noodles & General Tsao Meatless Chicken), great service and nice atmosphere - we will be back!
author: K S.

description: Best Chinese delivery in SF. The tofu "chicken" dishes are great as well as the real meat. Cumin lamb also recommended.
author: Eric W.

description: I'm not super picky about Chinese food. I usually order from Red Jade, but when Wonderland opened in the neighborhood I jumped in for lunch. Great prices for their lunch specials. Right on par with most chinese restaurant prices. I did take away, so I'm not sure how good the service is, but everyone was pleasant and attentive when I ordered, and picked up my food. The inside is really nice and bright, very welcoming. I got the Kung Poa Chicken and the app sampler, my usual to share with friends. Finally, a Chinese restaurant in the Lower Haight. They got an extra star for not being a Indian Restaurant.
author: Devon C.

description: So, did they put Chilli Cha Cha out of business? I know it's Chinese and not Thai but just sayin'. This is my go-to spot in the hood for decent take-out. Really feeling the Singapore Style Rice Noodle. The Mongolian Beef is the bomb, too. Lots of healthy options as well. Andy is super-friendly and they always recognize my voice when I call.
author: Michael P.

description: YES! Finally! A Chinese restaurant in the lower haight was much needed. When they were working on it I thought it was going to be a Mexican restaurant because of the paint job on the outside lol. Turns out its just a Rastafari looking Chinese place haha. The inside is cute! I didn't eat inside because I wanted to go back to my apartment and eat it with a bottle of wine and a girls marathon, but its cute in there. It would probably be a good date spot. I ordered pork pot stickers (the sauce alone is to die for!), chicken fried rice, sweet and sour soup, and Kung pao chicken. Everything was so tasty!! This is my new go to neighborhood Chinese place. Im gonna fat in 3...2...
author: heather m.

description: We ordered take-out last week and the food was tasty, however two out of four people had a reaction from something in the food (not serious, but ruined an otherwise nice evening).  I believe it was due to excessive MSG that was used in the dishes..  Have not had a chance to contact them about this yet.
author: John C.

description:
I'm generally a fan of tiny, hole-in-the-wall, no-English-menu Chinese restaurants, but I have to commend Wonderland for having solid Chinese food, generous portions, and at an extremely reasonable price.  

I'm within walking distance of Wonderland, but I was feeling particularly lethargic today and decided to check out their online menu and realized that they do free delivery to my neighborhood.  SCORE!  Even better- they let you order and pay online.  

I ordered the meatless general tsao's chicken and chicken chow fun.  The meatless general tsao's was delicious, and the chow fun was plentiful (albiet a bit on the bland side).  I was intrigued by the fried brown rice, and will probably try that the next time around.  There was definitely enough food to generously serve two.  

I was extremely impressed that my food was promptly delivered within 30 minutes of order.  That's probably the same amount of time it would have taken me to order, walk to Wonderland, and walk home.  This place definitely gets an extra star for speediness.  I'm definitely coming back!
author: Amy C.

description: I just ate here for the first time and I really liked it. We got the salt and pepper meatless chicken, crab rangoon & vegetarian spring rolls. We both really enjoyed our meal and even have leftovers. There are plenty of vegetarian options, which I appreciate, and the prices are totally reasonable. Having frequented Big Lantern in the Mission for so long (because of their meatless chicken options) I will likely be switching over to my Wonderland because it is not only so yummy but it is in my neighborhood.
author: Hayley T.

description: I have ordered delivery from Wonderland a few times now and it has been consistently good.  The crab rangoon is my favorite item on their menu.  I also order the Mongolian beef.  It is a bit milder than other Mongolian beef I have had, but I still enjoy it.
author: Sarah F.

description: Love their food so awesome I order from them plenty of times love their brown fried rice havnt tasted rice like that in years
author: L B.

description:
I have not eaten here so I'm not really giving it one star. 

Note to the restaurant: you need to update Yelp and your website as to where you deliver. I live in 94115 on Fillmore at Broadway and according to both, it says you deliver here. But when I called the restaurant the woman said you have never delivered on Fillmore north of California. Confusing and too bad!
author: M. T.

description: This place is solid.  Good and fresh American Chinese food.  It reminds me of the better places I used to go to on the east coast.  They also deliver which is a big plus for my lazy roommates.  Also, the servers were incredibly friendly and accommodating.
author: Dan L.

description: I ordered delivery...first off..what kind of chinese place doesn't give rice with a dish??????? very american, sure but this is very american chinese....second they don't know how to fry food...overall ok american chinese food. I would have atleast expected rice.
author: Wes D.

description: Bomb ass food and great service! Highly recommended. Even the vegetarian dishes were ultra yummy and fit for a carnivore like me.
author: Maryam M.

description: Ordered delivery. The web site said our address was out of bounds however map showed us inside delivery zone. Called order in and received great service. Food was delivered in 30 min. The foods was hot and fresh. I was disappointed that the salt and pepper shrimp were breaded and deep fried. Overall a decent choice for delivery.
author: Hidegrl A.

description: Crab Rangoon.... dank to the max! really good. Also got General tso's and was tasty and perfectly cooked. the waiter we had was also really funny and high spirited.
author: Drawing G.

description:
We order delivery many times before from this place and never had a problem. This time tho it was awful 1st we where told the wrong total over the phone when we order and when we got our food it was a completely different one! And to top it all off  the delivery person was very rude and even push my front door nocking me out of the way when he was leaving :( so very unfortunate because again the food is not bad. 

Would I ever order from them again!? Mmm NO!
author: Edgar L.

description: Wonderland is everything I might want in a Chinese restaurant in SF.  The interior is cozy, but still makes my think of all the Chinese restaurants I grew up with.  The menu is the standard laundry list, but the food is far from hum drum.  I particularly enjoyed their Kung Pao with meatless chicken (just as good as the real thing!).  All the veggies (peppers, zucchini, jalapenos) were perfect additions. I was also a fan of the General Tso's with real chicken.  The batter around the chicken was perfectly crispy and there was actual solid chunks of chicken under the breading.  This might just become the restaurant I eat at exclusively when I am in the Lower Haight.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Sesame chicken was almost inedible. It was overdone and extremely tough to chew. Vegetables were OK. pot stickers were gigantic but only half filled so youre pretty much just eating dough. I have absolutely no idea how this place got a better review than House of Nanking...maybe I went on a bad day.
author: Jerimy L.

description:
I usually order for pick up. The food here is yummy, good portions and is ready fast. I recommend the basil eggplant with prawns and chicken, the own ton soup, or pot stickers.

I'm still working my way down the menu.
author: Kate L.

description: For those of you who appreciate good food , or at least tasty food .. This is not the place for you . Ordered the soup can't remember the name had nothing more then a taste and it was just bad ! The dumpling pretty much weren't that good , and my fish dish was just awful , needles to say I had a bite from each to decide that the food is not good , the servers though were great and did provide excellent service , price was good to , I mean actually it was cheap so that's why the second star
author: Michal S.

description: I really liked their Garlic Chicken and the Szechuan Fish.  Very good find.
author: Omar F.

description: Excellent service and speedy delivery, but the food is just OK. I ordered moo-shu and spring rolls several times. The greasiness and salt overload wipes out the taste. The sweet and sour chicken can be good or tough - it's inconsistent. I recommend if you are in the Haight craving Chinese food (perhaps hungover?), but not for delivery.
author: K Z.

description: Surprisingly good! Don't call for delivery though, order online. I was on hold forever and the delivery took a while, but the food was quite good and the price was not bad.
author: Alex R.

description: Tasty, creative Chinese in a convenient corner location in the much needed neighborhood of Lower Haight. The salmon and asparagus is fresh and tender with the perfect amount of sauce; portions big enough to take for lunch tomorrow. The BBQ spare ribs are not-your-fall-off-the-bone-ones-your-mama-used-to-make-in-the-crock-pot. The service is attentive and enthusiastic.... and with $5 glass/$18 bottle with quick service---Wonderland is a definite easy place to go on a weeknight after a long work day.
author: Hez B.

description: amazing potstickers. best I have ever had. They make the dough themselves. delicious. and really great meatless options.
author: Mister M.

description:
the wonton soup was amazing, and the service was outstanding! i'm looking forward to trying everything on the menu -  :)
i'm so happy that we have such a delightful gem in our neighborhood.  i'm sure there will be great things to come for wonderland!
author: Tina J.

description: We were visiting San Francisco for the weekend and had a craving for Chinese food, found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. Best decision, the food was great, super service. The food was delicious, especially the wonton soup, we will definetly come back on our next visit to San Francisco
author: S A.

description: We ate here soon after it opened and everything was superb! The service was excellent, much better than you would expect from the entree prices. The menu is very extensive, and everything we tried was delicious. We got the spicy eggplant and the mongolian fish. I was a little scared when I found out that the fish was catfish--I've never had a chinese fish dish before, but it was great! The sauce was delicious and the fish was tender, flaky and moist. I will definitely be going back!
author: Alyssa S.

description: The food is good, but I have been waiting for delivery for an hour and a half. The phone is busy or keeps ringing. Delivery.com wanted to cancel the order when I told them. This kinda sucks because I'm hungry and ordered at 7:53pm... it is now 9:30pm and no food. Unsure if it will ever arrive.
author: Steve D.

description: This place is pretty good.... Walnut shrimp was delicious  and the general tao's chicken was delicious, although a bit heavy.  I was in the mood for soup and tried the wor wonton soup which I would not order again... They deliver which I love but I would probably rather go to a cheaper, more authentic place if there were one nearby.
author: Julie B.

description:
I just learned of this place opening. My boyfriend and I have talked about how there really needs to be a Chinese restaurant in the area.

We went last night, kind of before they were closing. They service was super friendly and fast. It's so hit and miss with Chinese places though. But this place was spot on. And I would say it's on par with Red Jade and Big Lantern. We ordered wonton soup, which was the best wonton I've had in the city amazingly flavorful. Kungpao chicken which is my boyfriends favorite meal, he said it was really good but not as good as Big Lantern. The green bean and chicken is my favorite and it was super tasty. We also ordered a curry dish, amazing. and a chicken with vegetables that came with a few sauce options, we chose basil which kind of reminded us of a plum sauce. 

I'm so excited that this place is in the neighborhood and is a decent walk from our house. I'm also excited about them delivering. Which I hope is faster than Red Jade and Big Lantern (60-80 mins delivery times) since it's a lot closer. I will definitely edit my post when I find out their delivery times.
author: Alice T.

description: Pretty good spot. Not really any  good CHinese restaurants in the area. Was pleasantly surprised.
author: Ethan S.

description: I've only ordered to go dishes so can't judge their waiter service. Their lunch special and entrees are delicious. The ingredients is fresh. The chef/cook is excellent. The food is delicious. They're consistent. I order the chicken basil and have never gone wrong. The only reason they don't get a five star is bec they don't let me walk in holding my under 5 lbs puppy to order but it's ok 'cuz the food is worth it!
author: Emmanuella A.

description:
Ordered :  
Sizzling Rice Soup : 2/5
Mu-Shu Chicken : 0/5. Too less chicken, too much of what I assume was cabbage.
Chow Fun with Meat : 2/5

Will Order Again : 1/5. Maybe some other dish, definitely not the above ones.
author: Rachit A.

description: Came here for lunch, they have amazing lunch deals! I got the mapo tofu and it came with rice, salad, and soup.  I like their hot and sour soup and the mapo was better than most places I've tried. Service was friendly and attentive. I will definitely come back again!
author: Susan T.

description: Not sure how to rate it until they have the menu with what is vegan. I have ordered and am hesitant to eat it until they have a vegan specific menu. Otherwise delivery was friendly and fast!
author: Paula H.

description: Delivery order -- I'd say it's actually 3***1/2 but will round up to 4. The delivery came quickly and the food was piping hot. The crab rangoon and potstickers (pork) were delicious and delightful! Their sauces were very nice -- a step up form standard takeout fare. I should have stopped there. The 2 appetizers would have made a sufficiently sized meal, but I was curious about the sesame chicken and brown rice I'd ordered, so served up a small portion. The brown rice was perfectly cooked. However, the sesame chicken was out of step with everything else; first, it was exceedingly sweet(!!); second, it had a curious, intense, bright-sour-acidic syrupy glaze that had the effect of making me grind my teeth--I've never experienced such a thing, and can't explain it better, but it was unpleasant; third, the chicken was cut in strips, which were very hard to chew--beyond rubbery. Again, I really wish we could give 1/2 stars because this was not a 4* experience, given the chicken, but it wouldn't be accurate to say 3 either.
author: Swiss C.

description: Good, fast, big portions. Yum!
author: E L.

description: Great, fresh food. Amazing prices. Happy to have them in the neighborhood.
author: Chloe S.

description: Had an excellent dinner here last night.  We had the orange chicken, green bean beef, kung pao chicken, and the spicy house chow fun.  I cannot say enough about the food and service.  The service was excellent.  The employees were all happy to serve you unlike some other Chinese restaurants where you barely get a grunt from them.  Our water glasses never got empty.  The orange chicken was excellent, so crispy and full of flavor.  The green bean beef was so fresh and the meat so tender.  Was a little disappointed in the chow fun as the flavor was not what I expected, but it was chocked full of various proteins and veggies.  The atmosphere was good as well.  I highly recommend and can't wait to go again.
author: Katherine B.

description: This food has to be damned delicious, especially after just swallowing my pride and continuing on with my takeout order.  I'm literally still in this place waiting and could not wait to YELP! The guy taking my order ANDY is acting like a total prick when I just want to order some food. As soon as I start my order some guy comes in for his takeout and ANDY just drops my order to hand this guy his food. Ok, start again. But wait here comes some other person for her takeout halfway through my order so let's not only drop my order but turn around and hand her a glass of water too. "What else?" says ANDY. I'll take a large plate of finish my order and show some respect. Almost walked out but feeling maybe a little too patient (and hungry) so I guess I'll vent here. But this better be delicious because this guy is an ass!
author: Ron P.

description:
So nice to have a chinese restaurant in the neighborhood! The menu is pretty standard American Chinese restaurant selectionn-wise, but everything I've had has been done really well - this is not a generic greasy chinese place. Ingredients are fresh, dishes are obviously made with care, and the servers know the menu. If you ask for spicy, you get.for-real spicy. It's clean and nicely decorated and not a depressing cavern like the old place. As others mentioned, the staff try hard, maybe too hard, but I'm happy to take that over thoughtless or rude service, since they obviously care about doing a good job. 
The only thing I'd like to see change is perhaps for the menu to be narrowed down quite a bit, maybe with some regional specialties added in place of the long lists of the usual items.
author: queue q.

description: Had delivery last night from here and it was so good I am ordering again tonight, I ordered online and they came exactly at the time I requested and the food was great and inexpensive. Very Nice!
author: Maureen O.

description: Amazing Chinese food!  Been all around this menu and have yet to be disappointed.  The basil eggplant with prawns is my absolute favorite here and a must try!
author: Phil H.

description: Who doesn't love 4 stars and one dollar sign?   Went last night with friends and Wonderland satisfied in all the right ways.  Best sizzling rice soup I've had in a long time; very fresh ingredients.   We had the spicy eggplant and the mango chicken which again tasted fresh and not overly sauced.  Vegetarians at the table were very happy with their meatless options.   Will be back
author: Greg L.

description:
I have ate inside and ordered out a few times and I have never been unsatisfied. My boyfriend and I moved to Lower Haight over a year ago and we were extremely disappointed with the lack of GOOD Chinese food that would deliver to us. 

Once this place opened we were more than excited to give them a try, and we have not been let down since! 

The service is always fast and friendly. And the sesame chicken is always good. 

Our delivery always comes within a half hour.. faster than most places we get delivered and the food is always hot and never soggy. 

I highly recommend the sesame chicken and the BBQ pork ribs.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Wonderland is now my and my husband's favorite Chinese restaurant.  Service is friendly and often quick.  The food is good quality and there are some dishes I have not seen elsewhere -- like cumin tofu.  And well, I have to admit, I love the name of the place!
author: Renee C.

description: Really tasty Chinese food in the Lower Haight. Not quite 5 stars, but certainly 4. I notice that a lot of Chinese postal workers eat there. The service is very kind. Get the vegetarian dishes. I'm a little put off by the strange western salad that comes with dishes, but the soup is simple and good. The general chicken made me feel too greased out, but I liked the broccoli with it.
author: Aaron W.

description: Went there for lunch, nothing to improve on. Great prices, food super tasty, and nice staff. I got the basil  eggplant with chicken and shrimps and it was amazing!
author: Paula B.

description:
My dining companion had spotted Wonderland on a stroll through Lower Haight, so we decided to try it out. It was about 7:30 on a Friday night, and it was busy, but not swamped, which was great -- we were able to get a table right away -- which I always appreciate (especially because I was starving!)

Our server was attentive, well-informed about the ingredients in each dish, and very accurate with our order  -- he repeated it back to us before heading off to the kitchen, which was very refreshing for someone like me, who is a picky eater...

The food arrived quickly and piping hot. We had the avocado spring rolls, the wor wonton soup, the pork chow mein and the garlic chicken (with white meat -- not sure if it always has white meat, but we requested it). Everything was delicious!! The garlic chicken was my favorite. The portions were large, the prices were very reasonable. The service was stellar. 

My only small comments, which are a bit nit-picky:
-  the soup had more soy sauce flavor than I was used to with wor wonton soup. It was still very tasty, full of fresh veggies, meat and delicious wontons. I would definitely order it again for sure.
- the veggies in the Garlic Chicken were a bit large (I believe it was leeks or giant green onions), which are hard to eat when you have no knife. But again, absolutely delicious dish that I will order again.

I will definitely be going back (I live in the Marina but it will be worth the drive and parking challenge) and I will be telling all of my friends to try it out.  There are only a handful of Chinese restaurants in the city that I like, and this is now on my short list.

Thanks, Wonderland, for a delicious meal!!!
author: rachel s.

description: I was once able to receive delivery from here (although we weren't suppose to as we are not in there delivery area) It was so delicious. I am upset that I can't  get it now. PLEASE add 94109 to your delivery. So tasty!!!!!!!!!
author: Mandy M.

description: I can't particularly say that whenever I call them for take out that they are friendly, however this being a chinese restaurant I usually look past that. On another note I have ordered take out 4 times, and each of the 4 times I was really satisfied with my food. Great price for the Lunch Special, keeps me coming back for more (also due to the fact that it is the only chinese place by where I live)
author: Chris H.

description:
Extremely happy with Wonderland up until today.

Normally when I go there everyone that works there is super-friendly and the food is good! I'd never had a problem up until today.

Today I went into the restaurant and ordered meatless sesame chicken to-go. Took it home and started eating it. Halfway through I started noticing the food tasted and looked A LOT like real chicken. It was in strips, too. I stopped eating for a while and ultimately decided I was just worrying unnecessarily because this kind of thing has happened before and it's ended up always being fake meat. Nowadays, certain fake meats look and taste REAL. I decided to finish the food, assuming since Wonderland has such a large vegetarian section they are cautious with their orders.

A couple hours later I started feeling sick and extremely nauseous. Partly because I couldn't help but worry I'd just ate chicken, but mainly because my digestive system wasn't ready to handle meat after all the meatless years.

I called Wonderland later to complain, starting by asking, "Is your meatless chicken cubed or in strips?" They said it depended which chicken. I said "the meatless sesame chicken," at which point the person on the phone said it was cubed. I told them I had gotten chicken in strips and had gotten sick because they gave me the wrong food. Instead of apologizing, the person on the phone proceeded to tell me that the server got confused, explained that the meatless sesame chicken was in cubes, and told me I had told the server I wanted real chicken. He then said, "Okay? Have a good day" and hung up.

Okay... so I understand miscommunication can happen between the customer and the server and the cook. I've worked in restaurants before and have made similar mistakes. I definitely told the server "meatless", I've been vegetarian for a long long time. What frustrates me was that the person on the phone did not once apologize for the mistake they made, and told me I ordered real chicken to avoid blame. What if this had happened with someone who had some sort of terrible allergy and they got wayyyy more sick than I did? I understand that if you're a vegan/vegetarian at a meat-serving restaurant it involves taking risks, but it's just not acceptable for a place that has such a large vegetarian menu.

I liked this place a lot, I'm just really disappointed with how they handled the situation and it didn't seem professional at all.
author: Caroline W.

description: 3 stars mainly for the fact there was little chicken in the dish (General Tso's) most pieces in the dish we ordered were breading rather than chicken. I enjoyed the flavor of the sauce, the soup and the veggie fried rice. The spring rolls were less than outstanding and ok at the same time. Visiting from Atlanta.
author: Rick E.

description: Great inexpensive Chinese Restaurant right at the corner of Fillmore and Haight.  I have gone there a few times for dinner, either alone or with my son and the food has always been fresh and good. They do tend to use more oil to prepare their dishes but you can tell them to hold back and they'll do that. They also offer healthy alternatives and meatless chicken dishes, along with brown rice so you really cannot go wrong. They recently added beer & wine, which is nice for dinner, orginially they only had tea and soda's.  The waiters are super nice and service is good.  I have also ordered their food to go, it's ready in 10 min and always good. Will reccomend and for sure keep coming here. It was about time we got a Chinese Restaurant here in the Lower Haight area!
author: Beth P.

description: I was excited to try Wonderland because I've walked by it so often. First the good. The ordering online was easy and the delivery was super quick.  The prices are also good.  The food, however....  The sesame chicken was grisly and stringy. I had to search around for pieces I could actually chew and swallow.  The vegetarian spring rolls were greasy and the hot and sour soup bland.  I don't know if I'll give Wonderland a shot again based on this experience.
author: Kris W.

description: Mmm....the General Tsao's chicken was my fave! I've been craving ever since!
author: ANTRICIA K.

description: After years of waiting for Chinese food in the Lower Haight, we were finally rewarded. We were thrilled to find that Wonderland has a good selection of vegetarian options, including veggie dumplings. Our toddler is nutso for their dumplings: we have to get two orders. Beyond that, the fried rice and noodles are good, and the shrimp dishes (we're not claiming all veg here) are all solid. The place is pretty chill, and the staff are super nice to us.
author: sellMyFing n.

description: In response to the question about the soup, I was a bit disappointed it was vegetarian primarily.
author: Captain B.

description: had lunch special there.  very good price, good service. sat in front of the window facing haight street.  its a very clean, well lighted restaurant with good service.  had mango chicken.  its really spicy in the fresh and yummy way.  it comes with white rice and fresh salad too.  veges are all fresh. really a great place to eat.
author: Shuting Z.

description: Great decor, food quality and presentation. Priced well.  Losses one star for not bringing me hot sauce I asked for and their hot and spicy needs a bit of tweaking. Otherwise excellent. I'll be back often as I live in the hood.
author: reza n.

description: Good food, great service and would recommend to anyone. It hit the spot and I was full so I was a happy man.
author: Jason H.

description: This is for takeout and vegetarians. I know it's not adventurous, but the general tso's meatless chicken here is amazing. So is everything else I've tried off of the extensive vegetarian menu. The portion size is as to be expected, which is more than enough. The preparation isn't the fastest but the staff is really attentive while you wait. I don't dare try any other Chinese place. No need to. Oh yeah, and of course the food is reasonably priced.
author: Ramon S.

description: After a long day and not wanting to go out, my wife found this place online. We ordered online a little skeptical... What a discovery!! Delishious dumplings! Fried brown rice? YUM! Chow mein, CHECK! Green bean tofu! GREAT! Not greasy at all!!  The test.... It was still good the next day! Great delivery option, right on time!
author: Chi chi R.

description: Great food for the price, by far the best take out option I've found over the last couple years. The general tsao is great as well as the string bean chicken if you're looking for a healthier option, but really can't go wrong. Great (read: quick) service and very friendly.
author: Nick H.

description: Fine and easy and delish. Good service. We had a huge party which is a perfect time to mess things up but they took great care of us. Ordered 10 dishes and all were great. The cumin lamb was a standout. Awesome.
author: Bob A.

description: The general tso's meatless chicken (fake meat / faux meat) is really good.  Nicely textured.  Good fried rice and veggies too.  Lunch special with fake meat + fried rice is ~$8.
author: Paul D.

description:
Very pleased from first impression. Will be returning to try other stuff. Veggie mu shu did not disappoint. 

In agreement with what has been said here: 
Solid Americanized Chinese food. 
Low prices for a large amount of food. 
Friendly staff.
author: girl p.

description: Ordered lunch from this place and there isn't much really to say - generic Chinese food. I ordered two of the most nondescript things you can order from a Chinese restaurant - lemon chicken and sweet and sour pork. They were as advertised - not good, not terrible. The chow mein was also terribly average, and the white rice was just white.
author: Matthew J W.

description: The service is very good, very friendly. I wanted to like the food. Just moved to the neighborhood. I ordered the fish and mixed vegetables and cashew chicken. The chicken was the usual slippery, salty little pieces of meat from bird parts unknown. The sauce was awful. It was almost worse than Panda Express. The fish was fresh. But, it was also salty, as was the sauce. My friend and I ate less than half and opted to not take the rest home. We were done. I was a little nauseated when I got home.
author: Bob B.

description: Staff was friendly and prompt. Food was good! I highly recommend the beef & broccoli. Try their hot tea-- delicious on a chilly night!
author: Amy G.

description: Slight above average chinese food. I'm not sure if its Hong Kong style or Taiwanese style. They use corn starch for their sauces which makes it gooey.
author: Robert S.

description: Tried it for the first time tonight.  It's refreshing to have Chinese food that isn't drenched in sauce. It almost felt healthy!    Our veggies weren't dripping in gooey sauce and the meat was tender and delicious but not greasy. We will definitely be back.
author: Candice H.

description: This place is incredible.  The staff is very service oriented.  The food is remarkable.   I have eaten in and also ordered for take-out.  Each time the food was hot, very tasty and not typical Chinese tasting.   I highly recommend it.
author: J D.

description: Extremely disappointing.  Ordered the Szechwan chicken, chow main, steamed rice, and pot stickers.  Placed the order online where they give you the option of choosing your delivery time.  We ordered at 5:15 with a delivery time of 6:15.  We waited the hour and we never received an order confirmation or anything saying the food was being prepared.  My friend called them and they said the driver was already on the way and should arrive any minute.  Another 30 minutes passes and no food and we are starving.  We weren't really sure what was up with the driver because we were told he was on the way.  My friend calls again and the guy says he will call the driver and see what's up.  A few minutes later the food arrives.  I'm like did you get lost because we've been waiting a half our past when we requested the food?  The guy points to the receipt and shows me it has a 6:45 delivery time on it.  I said no we requested 6:15 and he just kept pointing at he receipt saying we requested 6:45.  At that point I just said whatever and wanted to eat.  Sent the dude on his way and got down to business.  We loaded our plates and sat down to eat.  As I said we were already starving and then had to wait an extra half hour so we were looking forward to watching some jeopardy and getting our munch on.  I got about half way through my plate before my friend asked me if the chicken tasted funny to me.  I took a bite to check it out and noticed it had a kind of sour taste.  It was the same taste you get when you cook chicken that is going bad that's been sitting in the refrigerator for 3 or 4 days but is not quite spoiled yet.  I couldn't tell if it was this or the sauce they use.  Either way, not good.  The pot stickers were really thick and doughy but the chow main was good and you can't really screw up steamed rice.  The food was very average and the flavor of the chicken was sketchy.  Also the fortune cookies were the most bland and unappetizing I've ever tasted.  I will never eat here again and don't recommend it at all.  The food wasn't all that good and the guy obviously lied about the driver coming and then tried to blame it in us that he was late.  15 minutes after I was done eating I spent a good 20 minutes in the bathroom.  My friend fared better since she didn't finish her plate because it was so bad.  It makes my stomach hurt just thinking about it.
author: Kevin N.

description: the staff were really nice on the first day, even allowing me to use their wifi. Bt on my 3rd visit, they were very hostile, like they did not want me coming to that place again..it was really strange..now i understand why the place is always empty...i am never going there again
author: Derick A.

description: I personally love wonderland. The staff is so kind and I love how they give you gum with your receipt. The war wonton soup is the best I've ever had and there vegetable dishes are amazing. I love this place.
author: Stella L.

description: I have never had Chinese food this good! We ordered Mongolian beef, Mango Chicken, the Salmon with Asparagus and Lemon Chicken. Everything was above and beyond and the lemon chicken.... Oh there are no words for the deliciousness. Perfect crispy batter and the lemon zing was spot on. All plates were the Lunch Special which included salad, soup and rice for under $6 each (except the Salmon and that was about 7.50) I can't wait to be back in the area so we can eat here again.
author: Heather M.

description: New rule: once a month I have friends order all the food, have it served, then I show up to a table of more plates than people. It feels quite nice to just sit down & have at it. And, like Mark A said, our midwestern stomachs just want the General Tso sometimes. General Tso has been leading the charge of the not-so-light on the MSG brigade for a long time in my life. And he's winning the battle. I know the outcome: it's addictive, it's rich, and it turns me into a woozy bloated zephyr. Caution to the flatulence then, because sometimes I need it like you need sweets. I'm far from a purist when it comes to food, and this place personifies that feeling: just dish me what this craving calls for: American Chinese food -- and fancy this: it's a nice place with nice people running it. There's a bar without drinks but it won't be long before we find ourselves stumbling into this place getting fat on the feature items & reconnecting with our plainsmen past.
author: Jon A.

description: I have a problem. I'm addicted to picking up my phone and ordering a large Hot and Sour soup to go. They tell me there's a 15 minimum... Oh no! I'm gonna have to enjoy some potstickers and a can of coke too? Best damn day ever.
author: Kyle C.

description: Ate here last night.Very friendly, eager to please.Great decor.Terrible food.I sent back three dishes in a row;a record for me. Tasteless and tough, and that's just the bok choy! Sizzling rice soup: insipid.Even the fortune cookies were stale. V. nice people but they can't cook worth diddly. I live a block away so I may give it one more chance. I want to like the place.Maybe this review will stimulate them.
author: Roger G.

description: This is a pretty good choice for Chinese food in this city.  Their dishes are always really tasty and very interesting in flavor.  I personally am not such a fan of Shanghai style spices but other people who like it say this restaurant does it very well.  I really like their kung pao spiced dished.  Prices are really reasonable.  They also have nice large soups to share with your other dining partner/s.  We had a hot and sour one that was one of the best I've had to date.
author: Heather K.

description: Ate at Wonderland today, and had the orange chicken.  The portion was very large and it was cheap.  However, the chicken meat itself was borderline terrible.  At one time I wasn't sure if I was eating chicken or fried chicken-flavored mashed potatoes.  Also, there was an absurd amount of sugar even for orange chicken for my liking.  The rice was a bit dry.
author: Dima K.

description: Wonderful service. I ordered takeout, but had trouble finding parking. I ran in, leaving my car in the red zone. My food wasn't ready, so Andy told me he'd bring it out to my car, halfway up the block. He did, and it was great. Thanks!
author: Weste N.

description: Fast, fairly priced, big portions, delicious. We got hot and sour soup, mu shu chicken, and orange chicken, and it was all excellent. This is a good place!
author: Jack P.

description: Great food. The meatless chicken dishes are better than any "real" chicken anywhere. They also have the best customer service at any place I have ever been to.
author: Scott P.

description: This is a first class Chinese restaurant. They don't take short cuts with the sweet and sour pork. Excellent service, stylish decor. Sure, you can find finer Chinese restaurants in Chinatown -- gourmet and high-priced -- but most neighborhood-style Chinese restaurants offer poor substitutes for the classic dishes. This place offers the real thing at neighborhood prices. The Chinese broccoli is out of this world.
author: Douglas M.

description:
Being born and raised in S.F., I have eaten lots of Chinese food, and love it.  My friend and I were just walking around Lower Haight looking for something to eat.  With the great variety of foods down there, (not always good) she pointed out this new place right on the corner of Fillmore & Haight named Wonderland Restaurant. They had the copies of the menu outside, (which I find nice, so you can check what you are getting yourself into before hand) and saw we still had time for lunch. Lunch runs Mon.-Sat. 11-3:30 which we thought was great... and the lunch special items ran between $5.95- $6.95.  
Good deal, but would it really be good? 
O.K. enough set up... it was wonderful. Fresh, fresh, fresh, from the tea which you pay $3.00 for a good size pot, (I know pay) but it is made with nice loose leaf tea, (we had a fragrant Jasmine but they have others to choose from) and the pot itself had a nice sieve so the leaves aren't floating around in the bottom and going into your cup. Truly, it was so nice even if I wasn't really hungry I may just stop for a nice pot of tea.
Lunch specials come with a bowl of soup, along with a salad included on the main plate. The salad is made up of fresh varied lettuce (no iceberg... thank you) that added a nice little extra to the meal. You have a choice of white rice, or a very good brown rice for fifty cents more, and they give a good serving. We both loved what we had chosen, she got General Tsao Chicken, and I had Basil Eggplant w/Chicken & Prawns. She had broccoli on her dish that was just freshly steamed or fresh from the wok (nice bright green) and an abundance of savory chicken. My dish had a good amount of fresh basil, (hate it when you order something with basil and only get one leaf of it in your dish) along with a really good balance of the other ingredients. 
Now this is the first time I have been here 7/27/12 but I liked everything, from the nice not tacky decor, the service, real dishes not plastic, real table clothes, real fresh ingredients, clean, even to the varied background music.  
Can't believe it, I don't have one complaint, how often do we get to say that nowadays. Will be back soon. Thanks!
author: Liz D.

description: One dish killed it for us.  One freaking dish.  It was a Tuesday night and we were headed to a show and we needed a quick bite. My friend really wanted some Chow Fun so yelp led us to Wonderland.  It was a slow night so we were greeted and seated immediately.  Service was very good but naturally it should be when it's slow.  We ordered a small bowl of Won Ton soup, Pot Stickers, and the House Chow Fun. The Won Ton was the star of the meal bar none.  We both agreed on that immediately.  Flavorful with a hearty broth.  The pot stickers were huge and very good as well.  But eventually we got to the chow fun.  The one thing we came for and were highly disappointed.  The dish seemed over cooked and the noodles seemed a bit small for chow fun.  Flavor wise it just tasted like overcooked stir fry with which we thought was a ridiculous amount of MSG.  Our tongues were literally tingling after a couple bites.  The sensation didn't go away for a couple hours.  Not a place I'd recommend unless you needed Chinese food in that specific neighborhood.  We were hoping it would have been great find on our part but alas it just falls to the wayside as do most average or below average Chinese restaurants do.  Just a reminder to myself that great Chinese food is something to be cherished. My friend put it best.  "That dish was so bad it made me upset at 5 am. It's a WONDER that it didn't exit earlier."
author: Joco F.

description: If you're trying to order online... i suggest you call the restaurant first and ask if they "ACTUALLY" deliver to your address.. and not TRUST the information they give on the website... otherwise you just might waste 10 minutes of extreme hunger time making an account and making a lengthy well thought out order only to get to the end to be pissed off that they actually DO NOT DELIVER TO AN ADDRESS THAT THEY SAY IS CLEARLY INSIDE THEIR 2 MILE LIMIT.... signed, very hungry trusting diner.
author: NIKAS N.

description: Was solid as far as delivery goes. Only question - ordered the chicken wings and was only given half wings sans the meaty drumette part. Why no drumettes? You're making a lot of margin on those half wings Wonderland. C'mon, show some class and throw in some drumettes...
author: Rocky B.

description: Really amazing Chinese food. I've been there 3x in a course of 2 weeks and every time they don't disappoint. Only advice is to show up well before closing because as soon as they are ready to go they will speed up your service & turn the lights on so you get the hint. Aside from that the people, food, & vibe are great.
author: Jose B.

description: We were looking for a new Chinese takeout place that wasn't your typical greasy takeout. Wonderland definitely delivered! We ordered the Won Ton Soup, Mongolian Beef, General Tsao's Chicken, and the Eggplant with Garlic. All of the food was delicious! The chicken was moist and all white meat, the Mongolian beef was fresh and slightly spicy and the Won Ton Soup was delightful! The Eggplant was probably my least favorite because it did seem to have a lot of oil, but overall it was fantastic. We will definitely be getting food from them again.
author: Marisa W.

description: We went to Wonderland tonight with our kids. We went early and parking was so easy.  We were seated right away and the owners were so gracious and welcoming. We ordered several dishes: potstickers (not greasy at all, super good!), broccoli with garlic sauce, sesame chicken, mongolian beef and chow mein. All of our dishes were excellent and you can tell they use really fresh, high quality ingredients. The servers were very attentive and nice. Great chinese food in the Haight and we will definitely be back!
author: Jeannette C.

description: Standard Chinese-American fare but in a classier atmosphere.  Nice plate presentation and good service.
author: Alice Y.

description: I've been a regular here ever since they opened. I have tried various items, but my favorite is the kung pao chicken. As an aside, their environmental/cleanliness rating is 100, which is the only time I've ever seen it go that high. The staff is also very friendly, the food is fresh, and best of all it's only a couple of blocks from where I live!
author: C P.

description: Americanized or not, it's nice to eat at an MSG-free Chinese restaurant in SF that does not make me want to go out and take some antibiotics.  The food is darned good and the menu is extensive.  The inside is clean, neither hole-in-the-wall, hip, or douchey, kind of suburbany and nondescript.  It's nice that its down the street from my place and they deliver, too.  Sammy the waiter is a quirky fella who presents your food to you kind of like an old school italian restaurant in the Bronx would - proudly, informatively, with a well-placed pregnant pause and some cleverly coordinated body language.  FTW.
author: Madeline D.

description: Way over rated. I read the reviews and ordered delivery that was really fast....paid 45 bucks for cow mein, rice, pot stickers, general chicken and wings. 50 bucks with tip.  The food was not good, but i have been spoiled with sang tung in the sunset.  I was disappointed especially after seeing all the good reviews.  Pass!
author: Mike D.

description: Finally something on the corner that will hopefully stick around! Just what the 'hood needed: totally decent Chinese! Flavorful ungreasy food, tasteful clean decor, and super friendly service.
author: tania t.

description: Best Wonton soup, definitely recommend it! Orange chicken was also really good! Very large portion sizes too for both the soup and chicken.
author: Pat C.

description: This place gets four stars for great vegetarian options, prompt and very friendly service, and delicious not-at-all-greasy food. They even have a range of healthy options. This is our new go-to Chinese food restaurant. We especially like the avocado rolls appetizer and the dry sauteed green beans with tofu fried with garlic and salt - although everything we've had has been great.
author: Erin A.

description: Pretty good Americanized Chinese food. It's not the best I've ever had, but you definitely get your money's worth. Super nice owner too. I'll be going back soon.
author: Josh G.

description: Delivered hot.  Food fresh and not processed.  Loved the egg rolls, chow mein, mango chicken and eggplant dishes.
author: Karla D.

description: Great Chinese restaurant for vegetarians. Their menu has an awesome selection for vegetarians from the veg stir-fry to the meatless chicken. I got the onion pancakes as an appetizer, and General Tsao meatless chicken that my non-vegetarian friends actually loved.  The service was great, portions were big, and really dig the Rasta colors they chose for the exterior. Will definitely come back!
author: Lisa M.

description: I really like this place. I especially like that you can order single servings of soup instead of the standard large bowl that is best shared with many people.
author: Brent S.

description: I arrived at the restaurant at 9:25 on Friday night. I was greeted with we close at 10:00. I got it. I sit down and the waitress brings us a menu and tells us the same thing. We promptly order. The  food comes all at once and  five minutes into it the man from behind the counter comes over and tells us the register closes at ten.So we put our forks down and settle up as they are stacking chairs on the tables around us and there are two other tables still eating as well. We ask for a to go box and I go to the bathroom. When I come back to the table the lights have been turned off and so has the music ! Seriously ? It was 10:08 ! All tables took the not so subtle hints and exited . The food was mediocre and the service was so rude from the get go. I have worked in the food industry for twenty years and understand the servers want to leave , but they all crossed the line. Do they not understand that when you close at ten that does not mean the employees are walking out the door at that time?
author: Chris L.
